274 // wrapper around BringWindowToTop() API
275 static inline void wxBringWindowToTop(HWND hwnd)
276 {
277 #ifdef __WXMICROWIN__
278  // It seems that MicroWindows brings the _parent_ of the window to the top,
279  // which can be the wrong one.
280 
281  // activate (set focus to) specified window
282  ::SetFocus(hwnd);
283 #endif
284 
285  // raise top level parent to top of z order
286  if (!::SetWindowPos(hwnd, HWND_TOP, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE))
287  {
288  wxLogLastError(wxT("SetWindowPos"));
289  }
290 }

292 #ifndef __WXWINCE__

294 // ensure that all our parent windows have WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT style
295 static void EnsureParentHasControlParentStyle(wxWindow *parent)
296 {
297  /*
298  If we have WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT flag we absolutely *must* set it for our
299  parent as well as otherwise several Win32 functions using
300  GetNextDlgTabItem() to iterate over all controls such as
301  IsDialogMessage() or DefDlgProc() would enter an infinite loop: indeed,
302  all of them iterate over all the controls starting from the currently
303  focused one and stop iterating when they get back to the focus but
304  unless all parents have WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT bit set, they would never
305  get back to the initial (focused) window: as we do have this style,
306  GetNextDlgTabItem() will leave this window and continue in its parent,
307  but if the parent doesn't have it, it wouldn't recurse inside it later
308  on and so wouldn't have a chance of getting back to this window either.
309  */
310  while ( parent && !parent->IsTopLevel() )
311  {
312  LONG exStyle = wxGetWindowExStyle(parent);
313  if ( !(exStyle & WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT) )
314  {
315  // force the parent to have this style
316  wxSetWindowExStyle(parent, exStyle | WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT);
317  }
318 
319  parent = parent->GetParent();
320  }
321 }
322 
323 #endif // !__WXWINCE__

325 // GetCursorPos can return an error, so use this function
326 // instead.
327 // Error originally observed with WinCE, but later using Remote Desktop
328 // to connect to XP.
329 void wxGetCursorPosMSW(POINT* pt)
330 {
331  if (!GetCursorPos(pt))
332  {
333 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
334  wxLogLastError(wxT("GetCursorPos"));
335 #endif
336  DWORD pos = GetMessagePos();
337  // the coordinates may be negative in multi-monitor systems
338  pt->x = GET_X_LPARAM(pos);
339  pt->y = GET_Y_LPARAM(pos);
340  }
341 }

368 // Find an item given the MS Windows id
369 wxWindow *wxWindowMSW::FindItem(long id, WXHWND hWnd) const
370 {
371  // First check for the control itself and its Windows-level children which
372  // are mapped to the same wxWindow at wx level.
373  wxWindow *wnd = MSWFindItem(id, hWnd);
374  if ( wnd )
375  return wnd;
376 
377  // Then check wx level children.
378  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator current = GetChildren().GetFirst();
379  while (current)
380  {
381  wxWindow *childWin = current->GetData();
382 
383  wnd = childWin->FindItem(id, hWnd);
384  if ( wnd )
385  return wnd;
386 
387  current = current->GetNext();
388  }
389 
390  return NULL;
391 }
392 
393 // Find an item given the MS Windows handle
394 wxWindow *wxWindowMSW::FindItemByHWND(WXHWND hWnd, bool controlOnly) const
395 {
396  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator current = GetChildren().GetFirst();
397  while (current)
398  {
399  wxWindow *parent = current->GetData();
400 
401  // Do a recursive search.
402  wxWindow *wnd = parent->FindItemByHWND(hWnd);
403  if ( wnd )
404  return wnd;
405 
406  if ( !controlOnly
407 #if wxUSE_CONTROLS
408  || wxDynamicCast(parent, wxControl)
409 #endif // wxUSE_CONTROLS
410  )
411  {
412  wxWindow *item = current->GetData();
413  if ( item->GetHWND() == hWnd )
414  return item;
415  else
416  {
417  if ( item->ContainsHWND(hWnd) )
418  return item;
419  }
420  }
421 
422  current = current->GetNext();
423  }
424  return NULL;
425 }

460 // Destructor
461 wxWindowMSW::~wxWindowMSW()
462 {
463  SendDestroyEvent();
464 
465 #ifndef __WXUNIVERSAL__
466  // VS: make sure there's no wxFrame with last focus set to us:
467  for ( wxWindow *win = GetParent(); win; win = win->GetParent() )
468  {
469  wxTopLevelWindow *frame = wxDynamicCast(win, wxTopLevelWindow);
470  if ( frame )
471  {
472  if ( frame->GetLastFocus() == this )
473  {
474  frame->SetLastFocus(NULL);
475  }
476 
477  // apparently sometimes we can end up with our grand parent
478  // pointing to us as well: this is surely a bug in focus handling
479  // code but it's not clear where it happens so for now just try to
480  // fix it here by not breaking out of the loop
481  //break;
482  }
483  }
484 #endif // __WXUNIVERSAL__
485 
486  // VS: destroy children first and _then_ detach *this from its parent.
487  // If we did it the other way around, children wouldn't be able
488  // find their parent frame (see above).
489  DestroyChildren();
490 
491  if ( m_hWnd )
492  {
493  // VZ: test temp removed to understand what really happens here
494  //if (::IsWindow(GetHwnd()))
495  {
496  if ( !::DestroyWindow(GetHwnd()) )
497  {
498  wxLogLastError(wxT("DestroyWindow"));
499  }
500  }
501 
502  // remove hWnd <-> wxWindow association
503  wxRemoveHandleAssociation(this);
504  }
505 
506 }

514 // real construction (Init() must have been called before!)
515 bool wxWindowMSW::Create(wxWindow *parent,
516  wxWindowID id,
517  const wxPoint& pos,
518  const wxSize& size,
519  long style,
520  const wxString& name)
521 {
522  wxCHECK_MSG( parent, false, wxT("can't create wxWindow without parent") );
523 
524  if ( !CreateBase(parent, id, pos, size, style, wxDefaultValidator, name) )
525  return false;
526 
527  parent->AddChild(this);
528 
529  WXDWORD exstyle;
530  DWORD msflags = MSWGetCreateWindowFlags(&exstyle);
531 
532 #ifdef __WXUNIVERSAL__
533  // no borders, we draw them ourselves
534  exstyle &= ~(WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME |
535  WS_EX_STATICEDGE |
536  WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE |
537  WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE);
538  msflags &= ~WS_BORDER;
539 #endif // wxUniversal
540 
541  if ( IsShown() )
542  {
543  msflags |= WS_VISIBLE;
544  }
545 
546  if ( !MSWCreate(MSWGetRegisteredClassName(),
547  NULL, pos, size, msflags, exstyle) )
548  return false;
549 
550  InheritAttributes();
551 
552  return true;
553 }

559 void wxWindowMSW::SetFocus()
560 {
561  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
562  wxCHECK_RET( hWnd, wxT("can't set focus to invalid window") );
563 
564 #if !defined(__WXWINCE__)
565  ::SetLastError(0);
566 #endif
567 
568  if ( !::SetFocus(hWnd) )
569  {
570  // was there really an error?
571  DWORD dwRes = ::GetLastError();
572  if ( dwRes )
573  {
574  HWND hwndFocus = ::GetFocus();
575  if ( hwndFocus != hWnd )
576  {
577  wxLogApiError(wxT("SetFocus"), dwRes);
578  }
579  }
580  }
581 }
582 
583 void wxWindowMSW::SetFocusFromKbd()
584 {
585  // when the focus is given to the control with DLGC_HASSETSEL style from
586  // keyboard its contents should be entirely selected: this is what
587  // ::IsDialogMessage() does and so we should do it as well to provide the
588  // same LNF as the native programs
589  if ( ::SendMessage(GetHwnd(), WM_GETDLGCODE, 0, 0) & DLGC_HASSETSEL )
590  {
591  ::SendMessage(GetHwnd(), EM_SETSEL, 0, -1);
592  }
593 
594  // do this after (maybe) setting the selection as like this when
595  // wxEVT_SET_FOCUS handler is called, the selection would have been already
596  // set correctly -- this may be important
597  wxWindowBase::SetFocusFromKbd();
598 }
599 
600 // Get the window with the focus
601 wxWindow *wxWindowBase::DoFindFocus()
602 {
603  HWND hWnd = ::GetFocus();
604  if ( hWnd )
605  {
606  return wxGetWindowFromHWND((WXHWND)hWnd);
607  }
608 
609  return NULL;
610 }

612 void wxWindowMSW::DoEnable( bool enable )
613 {
614  MSWEnableHWND(GetHwnd(), enable);
615 }
616 
617 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWEnableHWND(WXHWND hWnd, bool enable)
618 {
619  if ( !hWnd )
620  return false;
621 
622  // If disabling focused control, we move focus to the next one, as if the
623  // user pressed Tab. That's because we can't keep focus on a disabled
624  // control, Tab-navigation would stop working then.
625  if ( !enable && ::GetFocus() == hWnd )
626  Navigate();
627 
628  return ::EnableWindow(hWnd, (BOOL)enable) != 0;
629 }
630 
631 bool wxWindowMSW::Show(bool show)
632 {
633  if ( !wxWindowBase::Show(show) )
634  return false;
635 
636  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
637 
638  // we could be called before the underlying window is created (this is
639  // actually useful to prevent it from being initially shown), e.g.
640  //
641  // wxFoo *foo = new wxFoo;
642  // foo->Hide();
643  // foo->Create(parent, ...);
644  //
645  // should work without errors
646  if ( hWnd )
647  {
648  ::ShowWindow(hWnd, show ? SW_SHOW : SW_HIDE);
649  }
650 
651  if ( IsFrozen() )
652  {
653  // DoFreeze/DoThaw don't do anything if the window is not shown, so
654  // we have to call them from here now
655  if ( show )
656  DoFreeze();
657  else
658  DoThaw();
659  }
660 
661  return true;
662 }
663 
664 bool
665 wxWindowMSW::MSWShowWithEffect(bool show,
666  wxShowEffect effect,
667  unsigned timeout)
668 {
669 #if wxUSE_DYNLIB_CLASS
670  if ( effect == wxSHOW_EFFECT_NONE ||
671  (GetParent() && !GetParent()->IsShownOnScreen()) )
672  return Show(show);
673 
674  if ( !wxWindowBase::Show(show) )
675  return false;
676 
677  typedef BOOL (WINAPI *AnimateWindow_t)(HWND, DWORD, DWORD);
678 
679  static AnimateWindow_t s_pfnAnimateWindow = NULL;
680  static bool s_initDone = false;
681  if ( !s_initDone )
682  {
683  wxDynamicLibrary dllUser32(wxT("user32.dll"), wxDL_VERBATIM | wxDL_QUIET);
684  wxDL_INIT_FUNC(s_pfn, AnimateWindow, dllUser32);
685 
686  s_initDone = true;
687 
688  // notice that it's ok to unload user32.dll here as it won't be really
689  // unloaded, being still in use because we link to it statically too
690  }
691 
692  if ( !s_pfnAnimateWindow )
693  return Show(show);
694 
695  // Show() has a side effect of sending a WM_SIZE to the window, which helps
696  // ensuring that it's laid out correctly, but AnimateWindow() doesn't do
697  // this so send the event ourselves
698  SendSizeEvent();
699 
700  // prepare to use AnimateWindow()
701 
702  if ( !timeout )
703  timeout = 200; // this is the default animation timeout, per MSDN
704 
705  DWORD dwFlags = show ? 0 : AW_HIDE;
706 
707  switch ( effect )
708  {
709  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_ROLL_TO_LEFT:
710  dwFlags |= AW_HOR_NEGATIVE;
711  break;
712 
713  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_ROLL_TO_RIGHT:
714  dwFlags |= AW_HOR_POSITIVE;
715  break;
716 
717  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_ROLL_TO_TOP:
718  dwFlags |= AW_VER_NEGATIVE;
719  break;
720 
721  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_ROLL_TO_BOTTOM:
722  dwFlags |= AW_VER_POSITIVE;
723  break;
724 
725  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_SLIDE_TO_LEFT:
726  dwFlags |= AW_SLIDE | AW_HOR_NEGATIVE;
727  break;
728 
729  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_SLIDE_TO_RIGHT:
730  dwFlags |= AW_SLIDE | AW_HOR_POSITIVE;
731  break;
732 
733  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_SLIDE_TO_TOP:
734  dwFlags |= AW_SLIDE | AW_VER_NEGATIVE;
735  break;
736 
737  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_SLIDE_TO_BOTTOM:
738  dwFlags |= AW_SLIDE | AW_VER_POSITIVE;
739  break;
740 
741  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_BLEND:
742  dwFlags |= AW_BLEND;
743  break;
744 
745  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_EXPAND:
746  dwFlags |= AW_CENTER;
747  break;
748 
749 
750  case wxSHOW_EFFECT_MAX:
751  wxFAIL_MSG( wxT("invalid window show effect") );
752  return false;
753 
754  default:
755  wxFAIL_MSG( wxT("unknown window show effect") );
756  return false;
757  }
758 
759  if ( !(*s_pfnAnimateWindow)(GetHwnd(), timeout, dwFlags) )
760  {
761  wxLogLastError(wxT("AnimateWindow"));
762 
763  return false;
764  }
765 
766  return true;
767 #else // wxUSE_DYNLIB_CLASS
768  return Show(show);
769 #endif
770 }
771

802 /* static */ wxWindow *wxWindowBase::GetCapture()
803 {
804  // When we receive WM_CAPTURECHANGED message, ::GetCapture() still returns
805  // the HWND that is losing the mouse capture. But as we must not release
806  // the capture for it (it's going to happen anyhow), pretend that there is
807  // no capture any more.
808  if ( gs_insideCaptureChanged )
809  return NULL;
810 
811  HWND hwnd = ::GetCapture();
812  return hwnd ? wxFindWinFromHandle(hwnd) : NULL;
813 }

815 bool wxWindowMSW::SetFont(const wxFont& font)
816 {
817  if ( !wxWindowBase::SetFont(font) )
818  {
819  // nothing to do
820  return false;
821  }
822 
823  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
824  if ( hWnd != 0 )
825  {
826  // note the use of GetFont() instead of m_font: our own font could have
827  // just been reset and in this case we need to change the font used by
828  // the native window to the default for this class, i.e. exactly what
829  // GetFont() returns
830  WXHANDLE hFont = GetFont().GetResourceHandle();
831 
832  wxASSERT_MSG( hFont, wxT("should have valid font") );
833 
834  ::SendMessage(hWnd, WM_SETFONT, (WPARAM)hFont, MAKELPARAM(TRUE, 0));
835  }
836 
837  return true;
838 }
839 
840 bool wxWindowMSW::SetCursor(const wxCursor& cursor)
841 {
842  if ( !wxWindowBase::SetCursor(cursor) )
843  {
844  // no change
845  return false;
846  }
847 
848  // don't "overwrite" busy cursor
849  if ( wxIsBusy() )
850  return true;
851 
852  if ( m_cursor.IsOk() )
853  {
854  // normally we should change the cursor only if it's over this window
855  // but we should do it always if we capture the mouse currently
856  bool set = HasCapture();
857  if ( !set )
858  {
859  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
860 
861  POINT point;
862  ::wxGetCursorPosMSW(&point);
863 
864  RECT rect = wxGetWindowRect(hWnd);
865 
866  set = ::PtInRect(&rect, point) != 0;
867  }
868 
869  if ( set )
870  {
871  ::SetCursor(GetHcursorOf(m_cursor));
872  }
873  //else: will be set later when the mouse enters this window
874  }
875  else // Invalid cursor: this means reset to the default one.
876  {
877  // To revert to the correct cursor we need to find the window currently
878  // under the cursor and ask it to set its cursor itself as only it
879  // knows what it is.
880  POINT pt;
881  wxGetCursorPosMSW(&pt);
882 
883  const wxWindowMSW* win = wxFindWindowAtPoint(wxPoint(pt.x, pt.y));
884  if ( !win )
885  win = this;
886 
887  ::SendMessage(GetHwndOf(win), WM_SETCURSOR,
888  (WPARAM)GetHwndOf(win),
889  MAKELPARAM(HTCLIENT, WM_MOUSEMOVE));
890  }
891 
892  return true;
893 }
894 
895 void wxWindowMSW::WarpPointer(int x, int y)
896 {
897  ClientToScreen(&x, &y);
898 
899  if ( !::SetCursorPos(x, y) )
900  {
901  wxLogLastError(wxT("SetCursorPos"));
902  }
903 }

905 void wxWindowMSW::MSWUpdateUIState(int action, int state)
906 {
907  // WM_CHANGEUISTATE only appeared in Windows 2000 so it can do us no good
908  // to use it on older systems -- and could possibly do some harm
909  static int s_needToUpdate = -1;
910  if ( s_needToUpdate == -1 )
911  {
912  int verMaj, verMin;
913  s_needToUpdate = wxGetOsVersion(&verMaj, &verMin) == wxOS_WINDOWS_NT &&
914  verMaj >= 5;
915  }
916 
917  if ( s_needToUpdate )
918  {
919  // we send WM_CHANGEUISTATE so if nothing needs changing then the system
920  // won't send WM_UPDATEUISTATE
921  ::SendMessage(GetHwnd(), WM_CHANGEUISTATE, MAKEWPARAM(action, state), 0);
922  }
923 }

932 inline int GetScrollPosition(HWND hWnd, int wOrient)
933 {
934 #ifdef __WXMICROWIN__
935  return ::GetScrollPosWX(hWnd, wOrient);
936 #else
937  WinStruct<SCROLLINFO> scrollInfo;
938  scrollInfo.cbSize = sizeof(SCROLLINFO);
939  scrollInfo.fMask = SIF_POS;
940  ::GetScrollInfo(hWnd, wOrient, &scrollInfo );
941 
942  return scrollInfo.nPos;
943 
944 #endif
945 }

948 {
949  return orient == wxHORIZONTAL ? SB_HORZ : SB_VERT;
950 }

954 int wxWindowMSW::GetScrollPos(int orient) const
955 {
956  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
957  wxCHECK_MSG( hWnd, 0, wxT("no HWND in GetScrollPos") );
958 
959  return GetScrollPosition(hWnd, WXOrientToSB(orient));
960 }
961 
962 // This now returns the whole range, not just the number
963 // of positions that we can scroll.
964 int wxWindowMSW::GetScrollRange(int orient) const
965 {
966  int maxPos;
967  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
968  if ( !hWnd )
969  return 0;
970  WinStruct<SCROLLINFO> scrollInfo;
971  scrollInfo.fMask = SIF_RANGE;
972  if ( !::GetScrollInfo(hWnd, WXOrientToSB(orient), &scrollInfo) )
973  {
974  // Most of the time this is not really an error, since the return
975  // value can also be zero when there is no scrollbar yet.
976  // wxLogLastError(wxT("GetScrollInfo"));
977  }
978  maxPos = scrollInfo.nMax;
979 
980  // undo "range - 1" done in SetScrollbar()
981  return maxPos + 1;
982 }

984 int wxWindowMSW::GetScrollThumb(int orient) const
985 {
986  return orient == wxHORIZONTAL ? m_xThumbSize : m_yThumbSize;
987 }
988 
989 void wxWindowMSW::SetScrollPos(int orient, int pos, bool refresh)
990 {
991  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
992  wxCHECK_RET( hWnd, wxT("SetScrollPos: no HWND") );
993 
994  WinStruct<SCROLLINFO> info;
995  info.nPage = 0;
996  info.nMin = 0;
997  info.nPos = pos;
998  info.fMask = SIF_POS;
999  if ( HasFlag(wxALWAYS_SHOW_SB) )
1000  {
1001  // disable scrollbar instead of removing it then
1002  info.fMask |= SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL;
1003  }
1004 
1005  ::SetScrollInfo(hWnd, WXOrientToSB(orient), &info, refresh);
1006 }
1007 
1008 // New function that will replace some of the above.
1009 void wxWindowMSW::SetScrollbar(int orient,
1010  int pos,
1011  int pageSize,
1012  int range,
1013  bool refresh)
1014 {
1015  // We have to set the variables here to make them valid in events
1016  // triggered by ::SetScrollInfo()
1017  *(orient == wxHORIZONTAL ? &m_xThumbSize : &m_yThumbSize) = pageSize;
1018 
1019  HWND hwnd = GetHwnd();
1020  if ( !hwnd )
1021  return;
1022 
1023  WinStruct<SCROLLINFO> info;
1024  if ( range != -1 )
1025  {
1026  info.nPage = pageSize;
1027  info.nMin = 0; // range is nMax - nMin + 1
1028  info.nMax = range - 1; // as both nMax and nMax are inclusive
1029  info.nPos = pos;
1030 
1031  // We normally also reenable scrollbar in case it had been previously
1032  // disabled by specifying SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL below but we should only
1033  // do this if it has valid range, otherwise it would be enabled but not
1034  // do anything.
1035  if ( range >= pageSize )
1036  {
1037  ::EnableScrollBar(hwnd, WXOrientToSB(orient), ESB_ENABLE_BOTH);
1038  }
1039  }
1040  //else: leave all the fields to be 0
1041 
1042  info.fMask = SIF_RANGE | SIF_PAGE | SIF_POS;
1043  if ( HasFlag(wxALWAYS_SHOW_SB) || range == -1 )
1044  {
1045  // disable scrollbar instead of removing it then
1046  info.fMask |= SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL;
1047  }
1048 
1049  ::SetScrollInfo(hwnd, WXOrientToSB(orient), &info, refresh);
1050 }
1051 
1052 void wxWindowMSW::ScrollWindow(int dx, int dy, const wxRect *prect)
1053 {
1054  RECT rect;
1055  RECT *pr;
1056  if ( prect )
1057  {
1058  wxCopyRectToRECT(*prect, rect);
1059  pr = &rect;
1060  }
1061  else
1062  {
1063  pr = NULL;
1064 
1065  }
1066 
1067 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
1068  // FIXME: is this the exact equivalent of the line below?
1069  ::ScrollWindowEx(GetHwnd(), dx, dy, pr, pr, 0, 0, SW_SCROLLCHILDREN|SW_ERASE|SW_INVALIDATE);
1070 #else
1071  ::ScrollWindow(GetHwnd(), dx, dy, pr, pr);
1072 #endif
1073 }
1074 
1075 static bool ScrollVertically(HWND hwnd, int kind, int count)
1076 {
1077  int posStart = GetScrollPosition(hwnd, SB_VERT);
1078 
1079  int pos = posStart;
1080  for ( int n = 0; n < count; n++ )
1081  {
1082  ::SendMessage(hwnd, WM_VSCROLL, kind, 0);
1083 
1084  int posNew = GetScrollPosition(hwnd, SB_VERT);
1085  if ( posNew == pos )
1086  {
1087  // don't bother to continue, we're already at top/bottom
1088  break;
1089  }
1090 
1091  pos = posNew;
1092  }
1093 
1094  return pos != posStart;
1095 }
1096 
1097 bool wxWindowMSW::ScrollLines(int lines)
1098 {
1099  bool down = lines > 0;
1100 
1101  return ScrollVertically(GetHwnd(),
1102  down ? SB_LINEDOWN : SB_LINEUP,
1103  down ? lines : -lines);
1104 }
1105 
1106 bool wxWindowMSW::ScrollPages(int pages)
1107 {
1108  bool down = pages > 0;
1109 
1110  return ScrollVertically(GetHwnd(),
1111  down ? SB_PAGEDOWN : SB_PAGEUP,
1112  down ? pages : -pages);
1113 }

1119 void wxWindowMSW::SetLayoutDirection(wxLayoutDirection dir)
1120 {
1121 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
1122  wxUnusedVar(dir);
1123 #else
1124  wxCHECK_RET( GetHwnd(),
1125  wxT("layout direction must be set after window creation") );
1126 
1127  LONG styleOld = wxGetWindowExStyle(this);
1128 
1129  LONG styleNew = styleOld;
1130  switch ( dir )
1131  {
1132  case wxLayout_LeftToRight:
1133  styleNew &= ~WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL;
1134  break;
1135 
1136  case wxLayout_RightToLeft:
1137  styleNew |= WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL;
1138  break;
1139 
1140  default:
1141  wxFAIL_MSG(wxT("unsupported layout direction"));
1142  break;
1143  }
1144 
1145  if ( styleNew != styleOld )
1146  {
1147  wxSetWindowExStyle(this, styleNew);
1148 
1149  // Update layout: whether we have children or are drawing something, we
1150  // need to redo it with the new layout.
1151  SendSizeEvent();
1152  Refresh();
1153  }
1154 #endif
1155 }
1156 
1157 wxLayoutDirection wxWindowMSW::GetLayoutDirection() const
1158 {
1159 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
1160  return wxLayout_Default;
1161 #else
1162  wxCHECK_MSG( GetHwnd(), wxLayout_Default, wxT("invalid window") );
1163 
1164  return wxHasWindowExStyle(this, WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL) ? wxLayout_RightToLeft
1165  : wxLayout_LeftToRight;
1166 #endif
1167 }

1179 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1180 // subclassing
1181 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1182 
1183 void wxWindowMSW::SubclassWin(WXHWND hWnd)
1184 {
1185  wxASSERT_MSG( !m_oldWndProc, wxT("subclassing window twice?") );
1186 
1187  HWND hwnd = (HWND)hWnd;
1188  wxCHECK_RET( ::IsWindow(hwnd), wxT("invalid HWND in SubclassWin") );
1189 
1190  SetHWND(hWnd);
1191 
1192  wxAssociateWinWithHandle(hwnd, this);
1193 
1194  m_oldWndProc = (WXFARPROC)wxGetWindowProc((HWND)hWnd);
1195 
1196  // we don't need to subclass the window of our own class (in the Windows
1197  // sense of the word)
1198  if ( !wxCheckWindowWndProc(hWnd, (WXFARPROC)wxWndProc) )
1199  {
1200  wxSetWindowProc(hwnd, wxWndProc);
1201 
1202  // If the window didn't use our window proc during its creation, the
1203  // code in HandleCreate() hasn't been executed, so do it here.
1204  if ( wxHasWindowExStyle(this, WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT) )
1205  EnsureParentHasControlParentStyle(GetParent());
1206  }
1207  else
1208  {
1209  // don't bother restoring it either: this also makes it easy to
1210  // implement IsOfStandardClass() method which returns true for the
1211  // standard controls and false for the wxWidgets own windows as it can
1212  // simply check m_oldWndProc
1213  m_oldWndProc = NULL;
1214  }
1215 
1216  // we're officially created now, send the event
1217  wxWindowCreateEvent event((wxWindow *)this);
1218  (void)HandleWindowEvent(event);
1219 }
1220 
1221 void wxWindowMSW::UnsubclassWin()
1222 {
1223  wxRemoveHandleAssociation(this);
1224 
1225  // Restore old Window proc
1226  HWND hwnd = GetHwnd();
1227  if ( hwnd )
1228  {
1229  SetHWND(0);
1230 
1231  wxCHECK_RET( ::IsWindow(hwnd), wxT("invalid HWND in UnsubclassWin") );
1232 
1233  if ( m_oldWndProc )
1234  {
1235  if ( !wxCheckWindowWndProc((WXHWND)hwnd, m_oldWndProc) )
1236  {
1237  wxSetWindowProc(hwnd, (WNDPROC)m_oldWndProc);
1238  }
1239 
1240  m_oldWndProc = NULL;
1241  }
1242  }
1243 }
1244 
1245 void wxWindowMSW::AssociateHandle(WXWidget handle)
1246 {
1247  if ( m_hWnd )
1248  {
1249  if ( !::DestroyWindow(GetHwnd()) )
1250  {
1251  wxLogLastError(wxT("DestroyWindow"));
1252  }
1253  }
1254 
1255  WXHWND wxhwnd = (WXHWND)handle;
1256 
1257  // this also calls SetHWND(wxhwnd)
1258  SubclassWin(wxhwnd);
1259 }
1260 
1261 void wxWindowMSW::DissociateHandle()
1262 {
1263  // this also calls SetHWND(0) for us
1264  UnsubclassWin();
1265 }

1268 bool wxCheckWindowWndProc(WXHWND hWnd,
1269  WXFARPROC WXUNUSED(wndProc))
1270 {
1271  const wxString str(wxGetWindowClass(hWnd));
1272 
1273  // TODO: get rid of wxTLWHiddenParent special case (currently it's not
1274  // registered by wxApp but using ad hoc code in msw/toplevel.cpp);
1275  // there is also a hidden window class used by sockets &c
1276  return wxApp::IsRegisteredClassName(str) || str == wxT("wxTLWHiddenParent");
1277 }

1283 void wxWindowMSW::SetWindowStyleFlag(long flags)

1286  if ( flags == flagsOld )
1287  return;
1288

1291

1296 void wxWindowMSW::SetExtraStyle(long exflags)
1297 {
1298  long exflagsOld = GetExtraStyle();
1299  if ( exflags == exflagsOld )
1300  return;
1301 
1302  // update the internal variable
1303  wxWindowBase::SetExtraStyle(exflags);
1304 
1305  // and the real window flags
1306  MSWUpdateStyle(GetWindowStyleFlag(), exflagsOld);
1307 }
1308 
1309 void wxWindowMSW::MSWUpdateStyle(long flagsOld, long exflagsOld)
1310 {
1311  // now update the Windows style as well if needed - and if the window had
1312  // been already created
1313  if ( !GetHwnd() )
1314  return;
1315 
1316  // we may need to call SetWindowPos() when we change some styles
1317  bool callSWP = false;
1318 
1319  WXDWORD exstyle;
1320  long style = MSWGetStyle(GetWindowStyleFlag(), &exstyle);
1321 
1322  // this is quite a horrible hack but we need it because MSWGetStyle()
1323  // doesn't take exflags as parameter but uses GetExtraStyle() internally
1324  // and so we have to modify the window exflags temporarily to get the
1325  // correct exstyleOld
1326  long exflagsNew = GetExtraStyle();
1327  wxWindowBase::SetExtraStyle(exflagsOld);
1328 
1329  WXDWORD exstyleOld;
1330  long styleOld = MSWGetStyle(flagsOld, &exstyleOld);
1331 
1332  wxWindowBase::SetExtraStyle(exflagsNew);
1333 
1334 
1335  if ( style != styleOld )
1336  {
1337  // some flags (e.g. WS_VISIBLE or WS_DISABLED) should not be changed by
1338  // this function so instead of simply setting the style to the new
1339  // value we clear the bits which were set in styleOld but are set in
1340  // the new one and set the ones which were not set before
1341  long styleReal = ::GetWindowLong(GetHwnd(), GWL_STYLE);
1342  styleReal &= ~styleOld;
1343  styleReal |= style;
1344 
1345  ::SetWindowLong(GetHwnd(), GWL_STYLE, styleReal);
1346 
1347  // we need to call SetWindowPos() if any of the styles affecting the
1348  // frame appearance have changed
1349  callSWP = ((styleOld ^ style ) & (WS_BORDER |
1350  WS_THICKFRAME |
1351  WS_CAPTION |
1352  WS_DLGFRAME |
1353  WS_MAXIMIZEBOX |
1354  WS_MINIMIZEBOX |
1355  WS_SYSMENU) ) != 0;
1356  }
1357 
1358  // and the extended style
1359  long exstyleReal = wxGetWindowExStyle(this);
1360 
1361  if ( exstyle != exstyleOld )
1362  {
1363  exstyleReal &= ~exstyleOld;
1364  exstyleReal |= exstyle;
1365 
1366  wxSetWindowExStyle(this, exstyleReal);
1367 
1368  // ex style changes don't take effect without calling SetWindowPos
1369  callSWP = true;
1370  }
1371 
1372  if ( callSWP )
1373  {
1374  // we must call SetWindowPos() to flush the cached extended style and
1375  // also to make the change to wxSTAY_ON_TOP style take effect: just
1376  // setting the style simply doesn't work
1377  if ( !::SetWindowPos(GetHwnd(),
1378  exstyleReal & WS_EX_TOPMOST ? HWND_TOPMOST
1379  : HWND_NOTOPMOST,
1380  0, 0, 0, 0,
1381  SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOACTIVATE |
1382  SWP_FRAMECHANGED) )
1383  {
1384  wxLogLastError(wxT("SetWindowPos"));
1385  }
1386  }
1387 }
1388 
1389 wxBorder wxWindowMSW::GetDefaultBorderForControl() const
1390 {
1391  return wxBORDER_THEME;
1392 }
1393 
1394 wxBorder wxWindowMSW::GetDefaultBorder() const
1395 {

1399 // Translate wxBORDER_THEME (and other border styles if necessary) to the value
1400 // that makes most sense for this Windows environment
1401 wxBorder wxWindowMSW::TranslateBorder(wxBorder border) const
1402 {
1403 #if defined(__POCKETPC__) || defined(__SMARTPHONE__)
1404  if (border == wxBORDER_THEME || border == wxBORDER_SUNKEN || border == wxBORDER_SIMPLE)
1405  return wxBORDER_SIMPLE;
1406  else
1407  return wxBORDER_NONE;
1408 #else
1409 #if wxUSE_UXTHEME
1410  if (border == wxBORDER_THEME)
1411  {
1412  if (CanApplyThemeBorder())
1413  {
1414  wxUxThemeEngine* theme = wxUxThemeEngine::GetIfActive();
1415  if (theme)
1416  return wxBORDER_THEME;
1417  }
1418  return wxBORDER_SUNKEN;
1419  }
1420 #endif
1421  return border;
1422 #endif
1423 }
1424 
1425 
1426 WXDWORD wxWindowMSW::MSWGetStyle(long flags, WXDWORD *exstyle) const
1427 {
1428  // translate common wxWidgets styles to Windows ones
1429 
1430  // most of windows are child ones, those which are not (such as
1431  // wxTopLevelWindow) should remove WS_CHILD in their MSWGetStyle()
1432  WXDWORD style = WS_CHILD;
1433 
1434  // using this flag results in very significant reduction in flicker,
1435  // especially with controls inside the static boxes (as the interior of the
1436  // box is not redrawn twice), but sometimes results in redraw problems, so
1437  // optionally allow the old code to continue to use it provided a special
1438  // system option is turned on
1439  if ( !wxSystemOptions::GetOptionInt(wxT("msw.window.no-clip-children"))
1440  || (flags & wxCLIP_CHILDREN) )
1441  style |= WS_CLIPCHILDREN;
1442 
1443  // it doesn't seem useful to use WS_CLIPSIBLINGS here as we officially
1444  // don't support overlapping windows and it only makes sense for them and,
1445  // presumably, gives the system some extra work (to manage more clipping
1446  // regions), so avoid it altogether
1447 
1448 
1449  if ( flags & wxVSCROLL )
1450  style |= WS_VSCROLL;
1451 
1452  if ( flags & wxHSCROLL )
1453  style |= WS_HSCROLL;
1454 
1455  const wxBorder border = TranslateBorder(GetBorder(flags));
1456 
1457  // After translation, border is now optimized for the specific version of Windows
1458  // and theme engine presence.
1459 
1460  // WS_BORDER is only required for wxBORDER_SIMPLE
1461  if ( border == wxBORDER_SIMPLE )
1462  style |= WS_BORDER;
1463 
1464  // now deal with ext style if the caller wants it
1465  if ( exstyle )
1466  {
1467  *exstyle = 0;
1468 
1469 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
1470  if ( flags & wxTRANSPARENT_WINDOW )
1471  *exstyle |= WS_EX_TRANSPARENT;
1472 #endif
1473 
1474  switch ( border )
1475  {
1476  default:
1477  case wxBORDER_DEFAULT:
1478  wxFAIL_MSG( wxT("unknown border style") );
1479  // fall through
1480 
1481  case wxBORDER_NONE:
1482  case wxBORDER_SIMPLE:
1483  case wxBORDER_THEME:
1484  break;
1485 
1486  case wxBORDER_STATIC:
1487  *exstyle |= WS_EX_STATICEDGE;
1488  break;
1489 
1490  case wxBORDER_RAISED:
1491  *exstyle |= WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME;
1492  break;
1493 
1494  case wxBORDER_SUNKEN:
1495  *exstyle |= WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE;
1496  style &= ~WS_BORDER;
1497  break;
1498 
1499 // case wxBORDER_DOUBLE:
1500 // *exstyle |= WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME;
1501 // break;
1502  }
1503 
1504  // wxUniv doesn't use Windows dialog navigation functions at all
1505 #if !defined(__WXUNIVERSAL__) && !defined(__WXWINCE__)
1506  // to make the dialog navigation work with the nested panels we must
1507  // use this style (top level windows such as dialogs don't need it)
1508  if ( (flags & wxTAB_TRAVERSAL) && !IsTopLevel() )
1509  {
1510  *exstyle |= WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT;
1511  }
1512 #endif // __WXUNIVERSAL__
1513  }
1514 
1515  return style;
1516 }
1517 
1518 // Setup background and foreground colours correctly
1519 void wxWindowMSW::SetupColours()
1520 {
1521  if ( GetParent() )
1522  SetBackgroundColour(GetParent()->GetBackgroundColour());
1523 }

1525 bool wxWindowMSW::IsMouseInWindow() const
1526 {
1527  // get the mouse position
1528  POINT pt;
1529  wxGetCursorPosMSW(&pt);
1530 
1531  // find the window which currently has the cursor and go up the window
1532  // chain until we find this window - or exhaust it
1533  HWND hwnd = ::WindowFromPoint(pt);
1534  while ( hwnd && (hwnd != GetHwnd()) )
1535  hwnd = ::GetParent(hwnd);
1536 
1537  return hwnd != NULL;
1538 }

1541 {

1545  {
1546  // note that we should generate the leave event whether the window has
1547  // or doesn't have mouse capture
1548  if ( !IsMouseInWindow() )
1549  {
1550  GenerateMouseLeave();
1551  }
1552  }
1553 #endif // !HAVE_TRACKMOUSEEVENT
1554 
1555  wxWindowBase::OnInternalIdle();
1556 }

1558 // Set this window to be the child of 'parent'.
1559 bool wxWindowMSW::Reparent(wxWindowBase *parent)
1560 {

1562  return false;
1563

1565  HWND hWndParent = GetParent() ? GetWinHwnd(GetParent()) : (HWND)0;
1566 
1567  ::SetParent(hWndChild, hWndParent);
1568 
1569 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
1570  if ( wxHasWindowExStyle(this, WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT) )
1571  {
1572  EnsureParentHasControlParentStyle(GetParent());
1573  }
1574 #endif // !__WXWINCE__
1575 
1576  return true;
1577 }

1594 void wxWindowMSW::DoThaw()
1595 {
1596  if ( !IsShown() )
1597  return; // hidden windows aren't frozen by DoFreeze
1598 
1599  SendSetRedraw(GetHwnd(), true);
1600 
1601  // we need to refresh everything or otherwise the invalidated area
1602  // is not going to be repainted
1603  Refresh();
1604 }

1606 void wxWindowMSW::Refresh(bool eraseBack, const wxRect *rect)
1607 {
1608  HWND hWnd = GetHwnd();
1609  if ( hWnd )
1610  {
1611  RECT mswRect;
1612  const RECT *pRect;
1613  if ( rect )
1614  {
1615  wxCopyRectToRECT(*rect, mswRect);
1616  pRect = &mswRect;
1617  }
1618  else
1619  {
1620  pRect = NULL;
1621  }
1622 
1623  // RedrawWindow not available on SmartPhone or eVC++ 3
1624 #if !defined(__SMARTPHONE__) && !(defined(_WIN32_WCE) && _WIN32_WCE < 400)
1625  UINT flags = RDW_INVALIDATE | RDW_ALLCHILDREN;
1626  if ( eraseBack )
1627  flags |= RDW_ERASE;
1628 
1629  ::RedrawWindow(hWnd, pRect, NULL, flags);
1630 #else
1631  ::InvalidateRect(hWnd, pRect, eraseBack);
1632 #endif
1633  }
1634 }

1641  }

1647 #endif // __WIN32__

1654 #if wxUSE_DRAG_AND_DROP || !defined(__WXWINCE__)
1655 
1656 #if wxUSE_STATBOX
1657 
1658 // we need to lower the sibling static boxes so controls contained within can be
1659 // a drop target
1660 static void AdjustStaticBoxZOrder(wxWindow *parent)
1661 {
1662  // no sibling static boxes if we have no parent (ie TLW)
1663  if ( !parent )
1664  return;
1665 
1666  for ( wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator node = parent->GetChildren().GetFirst();
1667  node;
1668  node = node->GetNext() )
1669  {
1670  wxStaticBox *statbox = wxDynamicCast(node->GetData(), wxStaticBox);
1671  if ( statbox )
1672  {
1673  ::SetWindowPos(GetHwndOf(statbox), HWND_BOTTOM, 0, 0, 0, 0,
1674  SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOACTIVATE);
1675  }
1676  }
1677 }
1678 
1679 #else // !wxUSE_STATBOX
1680 
1681 static inline void AdjustStaticBoxZOrder(wxWindow * WXUNUSED(parent))
1682 {
1683 }
1684 
1685 #endif // wxUSE_STATBOX/!wxUSE_STATBOX
1686 
1687 #endif // drag and drop is used

1689 #if wxUSE_DRAG_AND_DROP
1690 void wxWindowMSW::SetDropTarget(wxDropTarget *pDropTarget)
1691 {
1692  if ( m_dropTarget != 0 ) {
1693  m_dropTarget->Revoke(m_hWnd);
1694  delete m_dropTarget;
1695  }
1696 
1697  m_dropTarget = pDropTarget;
1698  if ( m_dropTarget != 0 )
1699  {
1700  AdjustStaticBoxZOrder(GetParent());
1701  m_dropTarget->Register(m_hWnd);
1702  }
1703 }
1704 #endif // wxUSE_DRAG_AND_DROP

1740 bool wxWindowMSW::IsSizeDeferred() const
1741 {

1744  m_pendingSize != wxDefaultSize )

1751 // Get total size
1752 void wxWindowMSW::DoGetSize(int *x, int *y) const
1753 {
1754 #if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1755  // if SetSize() had been called at wx level but not realized at Windows
1756  // level yet (i.e. EndDeferWindowPos() not called), we still should return
1757  // the new and not the old position to the other wx code
1758  if ( m_pendingSize != wxDefaultSize )
1759  {
1760  if ( x )
1761  *x = m_pendingSize.x;
1762  if ( y )
1763  *y = m_pendingSize.y;
1764  }
1765  else // use current size
1766 #endif // wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1767  {
1768  RECT rect = wxGetWindowRect(GetHwnd());
1769 
1770  if ( x )
1771  *x = rect.right - rect.left;
1772  if ( y )
1773  *y = rect.bottom - rect.top;
1774  }
1775 }
1776 
1777 // Get size *available for subwindows* i.e. excluding menu bar etc.
1778 void wxWindowMSW::DoGetClientSize(int *x, int *y) const
1779 {
1780 #if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1781  if ( m_pendingSize != wxDefaultSize )
1782  {
1783  // we need to calculate the client size corresponding to pending size
1784  //
1785  // FIXME: Unfortunately this doesn't work correctly for the maximized
1786  // top level windows, the returned values are too small (e.g.
1787  // under Windows 7 on a 1600*1200 screen with task bar on the
1788  // right the pending size for a maximized window is 1538*1200
1789  // and WM_NCCALCSIZE returns 1528*1172 even though the correct
1790  // client size of such window is 1538*1182). No idea how to fix
1791  // it though, setting WS_MAXIMIZE in GWL_STYLE before calling
1792  // WM_NCCALCSIZE doesn't help and AdjustWindowRectEx() doesn't
1793  // work in this direction neither. So we just have to live with
1794  // the slightly wrong results and relayout the window when it
1795  // gets finally shown in its maximized state (see #11762).
1796  RECT rect;
1797  rect.left = m_pendingPosition.x;
1798  rect.top = m_pendingPosition.y;
1799  rect.right = rect.left + m_pendingSize.x;
1800  rect.bottom = rect.top + m_pendingSize.y;
1801 
1802  ::SendMessage(GetHwnd(), WM_NCCALCSIZE, FALSE, (LPARAM)&rect);
1803 
1804  if ( x )
1805  *x = rect.right - rect.left;
1806  if ( y )
1807  *y = rect.bottom - rect.top;
1808  }
1809  else
1810 #endif // wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1811  {
1812  RECT rect = wxGetClientRect(GetHwnd());
1813 
1814  if ( x )
1815  *x = rect.right;
1816  if ( y )
1817  *y = rect.bottom;
1818  }
1819 
1820  // The size of the client window can't be negative but ::GetClientRect()
1821  // can return negative size for an extremely small (1x1) window with
1822  // borders so ensure that we correct it here as having negative sizes is
1823  // completely unexpected.
1824  if ( x && *x < 0 )
1825  *x = 0;
1826  if ( y && *y < 0 )
1827  *y = 0;
1828 }
1829 
1830 void wxWindowMSW::DoGetPosition(int *x, int *y) const
1831 {
1832  wxWindow * const parent = GetParent();
1833 
1834  wxPoint pos;
1835 #if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1836  if ( m_pendingPosition != wxDefaultPosition )
1837  {
1838  pos = m_pendingPosition;
1839  }
1840  else // use current position
1841 #endif // wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1842  {
1843  RECT rect = wxGetWindowRect(GetHwnd());
1844 
1845  // we do the adjustments with respect to the parent only for the "real"
1846  // children, not for the dialogs/frames
1847  if ( !IsTopLevel() )
1848  {
1849  // In RTL mode, we want the logical left x-coordinate,
1850  // which would be the physical right x-coordinate.
1851  ::MapWindowPoints(NULL, parent ? GetHwndOf(parent) : HWND_DESKTOP,
1852  (LPPOINT)&rect, 2);
1853  }
1854 
1855  pos.x = rect.left;
1856  pos.y = rect.top;
1857  }
1858 
1859  // we also must adjust by the client area offset: a control which is just
1860  // under a toolbar could be at (0, 30) in Windows but at (0, 0) in wx
1861  if ( parent && !IsTopLevel() )
1862  {
1863  const wxPoint pt(parent->GetClientAreaOrigin());
1864  pos.x -= pt.x;
1865  pos.y -= pt.y;
1866  }
1867 
1868  if ( x )
1869  *x = pos.x;
1870  if ( y )
1871  *y = pos.y;
1872 }
1873 
1874 void wxWindowMSW::DoScreenToClient(int *x, int *y) const
1875 {
1876  POINT pt;
1877  if ( x )
1878  pt.x = *x;
1879  if ( y )
1880  pt.y = *y;
1881 
1882  ::ScreenToClient(GetHwnd(), &pt);
1883 
1884  if ( x )
1885  *x = pt.x;
1886  if ( y )
1887  *y = pt.y;
1888 }
1889 
1890 void wxWindowMSW::DoClientToScreen(int *x, int *y) const
1891 {
1892  POINT pt;
1893  if ( x )
1894  pt.x = *x;
1895  if ( y )
1896  pt.y = *y;
1897 
1898  ::ClientToScreen(GetHwnd(), &pt);
1899 
1900  if ( x )
1901  *x = pt.x;
1902  if ( y )
1903  *y = pt.y;
1904 }
1905 
1906 bool
1907 wxWindowMSW::DoMoveSibling(WXHWND hwnd, int x, int y, int width, int height)
1908 {
1909 #if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1910  // if our parent had prepared a defer window handle for us, use it (unless
1911  // we are a top level window)
1912  wxWindowMSW * const parent = IsTopLevel() ? NULL : GetParent();
1913 
1914  HDWP hdwp = parent ? (HDWP)parent->m_hDWP : NULL;
1915  if ( hdwp )
1916  {
1917  hdwp = ::DeferWindowPos(hdwp, (HWND)hwnd, NULL, x, y, width, height,
1918  SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOOWNERZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE);
1919  if ( !hdwp )
1920  {
1921  wxLogLastError(wxT("DeferWindowPos"));
1922  }
1923  }
1924 
1925  if ( parent )
1926  {
1927  // hdwp must be updated as it may have been changed
1928  parent->m_hDWP = (WXHANDLE)hdwp;
1929  }
1930 
1931  if ( hdwp )
1932  {
1933  // did deferred move, remember new coordinates of the window as they're
1934  // different from what Windows would return for it
1935  return true;
1936  }
1937 
1938  // otherwise (or if deferring failed) move the window in place immediately
1939 #endif // wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1940  if ( !::MoveWindow((HWND)hwnd, x, y, width, height, IsShown()) )
1941  {
1942  wxLogLastError(wxT("MoveWindow"));
1943  }
1944 
1945  // if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING, indicates that we didn't use deferred move,
1946  // ignored otherwise
1947  return false;
1948 }
1949 
1950 void wxWindowMSW::DoMoveWindow(int x, int y, int width, int height)
1951 {
1952  // TODO: is this consistent with other platforms?
1953  // Still, negative width or height shouldn't be allowed
1954  if (width < 0)
1955  width = 0;
1956  if (height < 0)
1957  height = 0;
1958 
1959  if ( DoMoveSibling(m_hWnd, x, y, width, height) )
1960  {
1961 #if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1962  m_pendingPosition = wxPoint(x, y);
1963  m_pendingSize = wxSize(width, height);
1964  }
1965  else // window was moved immediately, without deferring it
1966  {
1967  m_pendingPosition = wxDefaultPosition;
1968  m_pendingSize = wxDefaultSize;
1969 #endif // wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
1970  }
1971 }
1972 
1973 // set the size of the window: if the dimensions are positive, just use them,
1974 // but if any of them is equal to -1, it means that we must find the value for
1975 // it ourselves (unless sizeFlags contains wxSIZE_ALLOW_MINUS_ONE flag, in
1976 // which case -1 is a valid value for x and y)
1977 //
1978 // If sizeFlags contains wxSIZE_AUTO_WIDTH/HEIGHT flags (default), we calculate
1979 // the width/height to best suit our contents, otherwise we reuse the current
1980 // width/height
1981 void wxWindowMSW::DoSetSize(int x, int y, int width, int height, int sizeFlags)
1982 {
1983  // get the current size and position...
1984  int currentX, currentY;
1985  int currentW, currentH;
1986 
1987  GetPosition(&currentX, &currentY);
1988  GetSize(&currentW, &currentH);
1989 
1990  // ... and don't do anything (avoiding flicker) if it's already ok unless
1991  // we're forced to resize the window
1992  if ( x == currentX && y == currentY &&
1993  width == currentW && height == currentH &&
1994  !(sizeFlags & wxSIZE_FORCE) )
1995  {
1996  if (sizeFlags & wxSIZE_FORCE_EVENT)
1997  {
1998  wxSizeEvent event( wxSize(width,height), GetId() );
1999  event.SetEventObject( this );
2000  HandleWindowEvent( event );
2001  }
2002  return;
2003  }
2004 
2005  if ( x == wxDefaultCoord && !(sizeFlags & wxSIZE_ALLOW_MINUS_ONE) )
2006  x = currentX;
2007  if ( y == wxDefaultCoord && !(sizeFlags & wxSIZE_ALLOW_MINUS_ONE) )
2008  y = currentY;
2009 
2010  AdjustForParentClientOrigin(x, y, sizeFlags);
2011 
2012  wxSize size = wxDefaultSize;
2013  if ( width == wxDefaultCoord )
2014  {
2015  if ( sizeFlags & wxSIZE_AUTO_WIDTH )
2016  {
2017  size = GetBestSize();
2018  width = size.x;
2019  }
2020  else
2021  {
2022  // just take the current one
2023  width = currentW;
2024  }
2025  }
2026 
2027  if ( height == wxDefaultCoord )
2028  {
2029  if ( sizeFlags & wxSIZE_AUTO_HEIGHT )
2030  {
2031  if ( size.x == wxDefaultCoord )
2032  {
2033  size = GetBestSize();
2034  }
2035  //else: already called GetBestSize() above
2036 
2037  height = size.y;
2038  }
2039  else
2040  {
2041  // just take the current one
2042  height = currentH;
2043  }
2044  }
2045 
2046  DoMoveWindow(x, y, width, height);
2047 }
2048 
2049 void wxWindowMSW::DoSetClientSize(int width, int height)
2050 {
2051  // setting the client size is less obvious than it could have been
2052  // because in the result of changing the total size the window scrollbar
2053  // may [dis]appear and/or its menubar may [un]wrap (and AdjustWindowRect()
2054  // doesn't take neither into account) and so the client size will not be
2055  // correct as the difference between the total and client size changes --
2056  // so we keep changing it until we get it right
2057  //
2058  // normally this loop shouldn't take more than 3 iterations (usually 1 but
2059  // if scrollbars [dis]appear as the result of the first call, then 2 and it
2060  // may become 3 if the window had 0 size originally and so we didn't
2061  // calculate the scrollbar correction correctly during the first iteration)
2062  // but just to be on the safe side we check for it instead of making it an
2063  // "infinite" loop (i.e. leaving break inside as the only way to get out)
2064  for ( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ )
2065  {
2066  RECT rectClient;
2067  ::GetClientRect(GetHwnd(), &rectClient);
2068 
2069  // if the size is already ok, stop here (NB: rectClient.left = top = 0)
2070  if ( (rectClient.right == width || width == wxDefaultCoord) &&
2071  (rectClient.bottom == height || height == wxDefaultCoord) )
2072  {
2073  break;
2074  }
2075 
2076  // Find the difference between the entire window (title bar and all)
2077  // and the client area; add this to the new client size to move the
2078  // window
2079  RECT rectWin;
2080  ::GetWindowRect(GetHwnd(), &rectWin);
2081 
2082  const int widthWin = rectWin.right - rectWin.left,
2083  heightWin = rectWin.bottom - rectWin.top;
2084 
2085  // MoveWindow positions the child windows relative to the parent, so
2086  // adjust if necessary
2087  if ( !IsTopLevel() )
2088  {
2089  wxWindow *parent = GetParent();
2090  if ( parent )
2091  {
2092  ::ScreenToClient(GetHwndOf(parent), (POINT *)&rectWin);
2093  }
2094  }
2095 
2096  // don't call DoMoveWindow() because we want to move window immediately
2097  // and not defer it here as otherwise the value returned by
2098  // GetClient/WindowRect() wouldn't change as the window wouldn't be
2099  // really resized
2100  if ( !::MoveWindow(GetHwnd(),
2101  rectWin.left,
2102  rectWin.top,
2103  width + widthWin - rectClient.right,
2104  height + heightWin - rectClient.bottom,
2105  TRUE) )
2106  {
2107  wxLogLastError(wxT("MoveWindow"));
2108  }
2109  }
2110 }
2111 
2112 wxSize wxWindowMSW::DoGetBorderSize() const
2113 {
2114  wxCoord border;
2115  switch ( GetBorder() )
2116  {
2117  case wxBORDER_STATIC:
2118  case wxBORDER_SIMPLE:
2119  border = 1;
2120  break;
2121 
2122  case wxBORDER_SUNKEN:
2123  case wxBORDER_THEME:
2124  border = 2;
2125  break;
2126 
2127  case wxBORDER_RAISED:
2128  border = 3;
2129  break;
2130 
2131  default:
2132  wxFAIL_MSG( wxT("unknown border style") );
2133  // fall through
2134 
2135  case wxBORDER_NONE:
2136  border = 0;
2137  }
2138 
2139  return 2*wxSize(border, border);
2140 }
2141

2182 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2183 // popup menu
2184 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2185 
2186 #if wxUSE_MENUS_NATIVE
2187 
2188 // yield for WM_COMMAND events only, i.e. process all WM_COMMANDs in the queue
2189 // immediately, without waiting for the next event loop iteration
2190 //
2191 // NB: this function should probably be made public later as it can almost
2192 // surely replace wxYield() elsewhere as well
2193 static void wxYieldForCommandsOnly()
2194 {
2195  // peek all WM_COMMANDs (it will always return WM_QUIT too but we don't
2196  // want to process it here)
2197  MSG msg;
2198  while ( ::PeekMessage(&msg, (HWND)0, WM_COMMAND, WM_COMMAND, PM_REMOVE) )
2199  {
2200  if ( msg.message == WM_QUIT )
2201  {
2202  // if we retrieved a WM_QUIT, insert back into the message queue.
2203  ::PostQuitMessage(0);
2204  break;
2205  }
2206 
2207  // luckily (as we don't have access to wxEventLoopImpl method from here
2208  // anyhow...) we don't need to pre process WM_COMMANDs so dispatch it
2209  // immediately
2210  ::TranslateMessage(&msg);
2211  ::DispatchMessage(&msg);
2212  }
2213 }

2215 bool wxWindowMSW::DoPopupMenu(wxMenu *menu, int x, int y)
2216 {
2217  menu->UpdateUI();
2218 
2219  wxPoint pt;
2220  if ( x == wxDefaultCoord && y == wxDefaultCoord )
2221  {
2222  pt = wxGetMousePosition();
2223  }
2224  else
2225  {
2226  pt = ClientToScreen(wxPoint(x, y));
2227  }
2228 
2229 #if defined(__WXWINCE__)
2230  static const UINT flags = 0;
2231 #else // !__WXWINCE__
2232  UINT flags = TPM_RIGHTBUTTON;
2233  // NT4 doesn't support TPM_RECURSE and simply doesn't show the menu at all
2234  // when it's use, I'm not sure about Win95/98 but prefer to err on the safe
2235  // side and not to use it there neither -- modify the test if it does work
2236  // on these systems
2237  if ( wxGetWinVersion() >= wxWinVersion_5 )
2238  {
2239  // using TPM_RECURSE allows us to show a popup menu while another menu
2240  // is opened which can be useful and is supported by the other
2241  // platforms, so allow it under Windows too
2242  flags |= TPM_RECURSE;
2243  }
2244 #endif // __WXWINCE__/!__WXWINCE__
2245 
2246  ::TrackPopupMenu(GetHmenuOf(menu), flags, pt.x, pt.y, 0, GetHwnd(), NULL);
2247 
2248  // we need to do it right now as otherwise the events are never going to be
2249  // sent to wxCurrentPopupMenu from HandleCommand()
2250  //
2251  // note that even eliminating (ugly) wxCurrentPopupMenu global wouldn't
2252  // help and we'd still need wxYieldForCommandsOnly() as the menu may be
2253  // destroyed as soon as we return (it can be a local variable in the caller
2254  // for example) and so we do need to process the event immediately
2255  wxYieldForCommandsOnly();
2256 
2257  return true;
2258 }
2259 
2260 #endif // wxUSE_MENUS_NATIVE

2266 WXLRESULT wxWindowMSW::MSWDefWindowProc(WXUINT nMsg, WXWPARAM wParam, WXLPARAM lParam)
2267 {
2268  WXLRESULT rc;
2269  if ( m_oldWndProc )
2270  rc = ::CallWindowProc(CASTWNDPROC m_oldWndProc, GetHwnd(), (UINT) nMsg, (WPARAM) wParam, (LPARAM) lParam);
2271  else
2272  rc = ::DefWindowProc(GetHwnd(), nMsg, wParam, lParam);
2273 
2274  // Special hack used by wxTextEntry auto-completion only: this event is
2275  // sent after the normal keyboard processing so that its handler could use
2276  // the updated contents of the text control, after taking the key that was
2277  // pressed into account.
2278  if ( nMsg == WM_CHAR )
2279  {
2280  wxKeyEvent event(CreateCharEvent(wxEVT_AFTER_CHAR, wParam, lParam));
2281  HandleWindowEvent(event);
2282  }
2283 
2284  return rc;
2285 }
2286 
2287 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWProcessMessage(WXMSG* pMsg)
2288 {
2289  // wxUniversal implements tab traversal itself
2290 #ifndef __WXUNIVERSAL__
2291  // Notice that we check for both wxTAB_TRAVERSAL and WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
2292  // being set here. While normally the latter should always be set if the
2293  // former is, doing it like this also works if there is ever a bug that
2294  // results in wxTAB_TRAVERSAL being set but not WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT as we
2295  // must not call IsDialogMessage() then, it would simply hang (see #15458).
2296  if ( m_hWnd &&
2297  HasFlag(wxTAB_TRAVERSAL) &&
2298  (wxGetWindowExStyle(this) & WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT) )
2299  {
2300  // intercept dialog navigation keys
2301  MSG *msg = (MSG *)pMsg;
2302 
2303  // here we try to do all the job which ::IsDialogMessage() usually does
2304  // internally
2305  if ( msg->message == WM_KEYDOWN )
2306  {
2307  bool bCtrlDown = wxIsCtrlDown();
2308  bool bShiftDown = wxIsShiftDown();
2309 
2310  // WM_GETDLGCODE: ask the control if it wants the key for itself,
2311  // don't process it if it's the case (except for Ctrl-Tab/Enter
2312  // combinations which are always processed)
2313  LONG lDlgCode = ::SendMessage(msg->hwnd, WM_GETDLGCODE, 0, 0);
2314 
2315  // surprisingly, DLGC_WANTALLKEYS bit mask doesn't contain the
2316  // DLGC_WANTTAB nor DLGC_WANTARROWS bits although, logically,
2317  // it, of course, implies them
2318  if ( lDlgCode & DLGC_WANTALLKEYS )
2319  {
2320  lDlgCode |= DLGC_WANTTAB | DLGC_WANTARROWS;
2321  }
2322 
2323  bool bForward = true,
2324  bWindowChange = false,
2325  bFromTab = false;
2326 
2327  // should we process this message specially?
2328  bool bProcess = true;
2329  switch ( msg->wParam )
2330  {
2331  case VK_TAB:
2332  if ( (lDlgCode & DLGC_WANTTAB) && !bCtrlDown )
2333  {
2334  // let the control have the TAB
2335  bProcess = false;
2336  }
2337  else // use it for navigation
2338  {
2339  // Ctrl-Tab cycles thru notebook pages
2340  bWindowChange = bCtrlDown;
2341  bForward = !bShiftDown;
2342  bFromTab = true;
2343  }
2344  break;
2345 
2346  case VK_UP:
2347  case VK_LEFT:
2348  if ( (lDlgCode & DLGC_WANTARROWS) || bCtrlDown )
2349  bProcess = false;
2350  else
2351  bForward = false;
2352  break;
2353 
2354  case VK_DOWN:
2355  case VK_RIGHT:
2356  if ( (lDlgCode & DLGC_WANTARROWS) || bCtrlDown )
2357  bProcess = false;
2358  break;
2359 
2360  case VK_PRIOR:
2361  bForward = false;
2362  // fall through
2363 
2364  case VK_NEXT:
2365  // we treat PageUp/Dn as arrows because chances are that
2366  // a control which needs arrows also needs them for
2367  // navigation (e.g. wxTextCtrl, wxListCtrl, ...)
2368  if ( (lDlgCode & DLGC_WANTARROWS) && !bCtrlDown )
2369  bProcess = false;
2370  else // OTOH Ctrl-PageUp/Dn works as [Shift-]Ctrl-Tab
2371  bWindowChange = true;
2372  break;
2373 
2374  case VK_RETURN:
2375  {
2376 #if wxUSE_BUTTON
2377  // currently active button should get enter press even
2378  // if there is a default button elsewhere so check if
2379  // this window is a button first
2380  wxWindow *btn = NULL;
2381  if ( lDlgCode & DLGC_DEFPUSHBUTTON )
2382  {
2383  // let IsDialogMessage() handle this for all
2384  // buttons except the owner-drawn ones which it
2385  // just seems to ignore
2386  long style = ::GetWindowLong(msg->hwnd, GWL_STYLE);
2387  if ( (style & BS_OWNERDRAW) == BS_OWNERDRAW )
2388  {
2389  // emulate the button click
2390  btn = wxFindWinFromHandle(msg->hwnd);
2391  }
2392  }
2393  else // not a button itself, do we have default button?
2394  {
2395  // check if this window or any of its ancestors
2396  // wants the message for itself (we always reserve
2397  // Ctrl-Enter for dialog navigation though)
2398  wxWindow *win = this;
2399  if ( !bCtrlDown )
2400  {
2401  // this will contain the dialog code of this
2402  // window and all of its parent windows in turn
2403  LONG lDlgCode2 = lDlgCode;
2404 
2405  while ( win )
2406  {
2407  if ( lDlgCode2 & DLGC_WANTMESSAGE )
2408  {
2409  // as it wants to process Enter itself,
2410  // don't call IsDialogMessage() which
2411  // would consume it
2412  return false;
2413  }
2414 
2415  // don't propagate keyboard messages beyond
2416  // the first top level window parent
2417  if ( win->IsTopLevel() )
2418  break;
2419 
2420  win = win->GetParent();
2421 
2422  lDlgCode2 = ::SendMessage
2423  (
2424  GetHwndOf(win),
2425  WM_GETDLGCODE,
2426  0,
2427  0
2428  );
2429  }
2430  }
2431  else // bCtrlDown
2432  {
2433  win = wxGetTopLevelParent(win);
2434  }
2435 
2436  wxTopLevelWindow * const
2437  tlw = wxDynamicCast(win, wxTopLevelWindow);
2438  if ( tlw )
2439  {
2440  btn = wxDynamicCast(tlw->GetDefaultItem(),
2441  wxButton);
2442  }
2443  }
2444 
2445  if ( btn && btn->IsEnabled() && btn->IsShownOnScreen() )
2446  {
2447  btn->MSWCommand(BN_CLICKED, 0 /* unused */);
2448  return true;
2449  }
2450 
2451  // This "Return" key press won't be actually used for
2452  // navigation so don't generate wxNavigationKeyEvent
2453  // for it but still pass it to IsDialogMessage() as it
2454  // may handle it in some other way (e.g. by playing the
2455  // default error sound).
2456  bProcess = false;
2457 
2458 #endif // wxUSE_BUTTON
2459 
2460 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
2461  // map Enter presses into button presses on PDAs
2462  wxJoystickEvent event(wxEVT_JOY_BUTTON_DOWN);
2463  event.SetEventObject(this);
2464  if ( HandleWindowEvent(event) )
2465  return true;
2466 #endif // __WXWINCE__
2467  }
2468  break;
2469 
2470  default:
2471  bProcess = false;
2472  }
2473 
2474  if ( bProcess )
2475  {
2476  wxNavigationKeyEvent event;
2477  event.SetDirection(bForward);
2478  event.SetWindowChange(bWindowChange);
2479  event.SetFromTab(bFromTab);
2480  event.SetEventObject(this);
2481 
2482  if ( HandleWindowEvent(event) )
2483  {
2484  // as we don't call IsDialogMessage(), which would take of
2485  // this by default, we need to manually send this message
2486  // so that controls can change their UI state if needed
2487  MSWUpdateUIState(UIS_CLEAR, UISF_HIDEFOCUS);
2488 
2489  return true;
2490  }
2491  }
2492  }
2493 
2494  if ( MSWSafeIsDialogMessage(msg) )
2495  {
2496  // IsDialogMessage() did something...
2497  return true;
2498  }
2499  }
2500 #endif // __WXUNIVERSAL__
2501 
2502 #if wxUSE_TOOLTIPS
2503  if ( m_tooltip )
2504  {
2505  // relay mouse move events to the tooltip control
2506  MSG *msg = (MSG *)pMsg;
2507  if ( msg->message == WM_MOUSEMOVE )
2508  wxToolTip::RelayEvent(pMsg);
2509  }
2510 #endif // wxUSE_TOOLTIPS
2511 
2512  return false;
2513 }
2514 
2515 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWTranslateMessage(WXMSG* pMsg)
2516 {
2517 #if wxUSE_ACCEL && !defined(__WXUNIVERSAL__)
2518  return m_acceleratorTable.Translate(this, pMsg);
2519 #else
2520  (void) pMsg;
2521  return false;
2522 #endif // wxUSE_ACCEL
2523 }

2525 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWShouldPreProcessMessage(WXMSG* WXUNUSED(msg))
2526 {
2527  // We don't have any reason to not preprocess messages at this level.
2528  return true;
2529 }

2531 #ifndef __WXUNIVERSAL__
2532 
2533 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWSafeIsDialogMessage(WXMSG* msg)
2534 {
2535  // don't let IsDialogMessage() get VK_ESCAPE as it _always_ eats the
2536  // message even when there is no cancel button and when the message is
2537  // needed by the control itself: in particular, it prevents the tree in
2538  // place edit control from being closed with Escape in a dialog
2539  if ( msg->message == WM_KEYDOWN && msg->wParam == VK_ESCAPE )
2540  {
2541  return false;
2542  }
2543 
2544  // ::IsDialogMessage() is broken and may sometimes hang the application by
2545  // going into an infinite loop when it tries to find the control to give
2546  // focus to when Alt-<key> is pressed, so we try to detect [some of] the
2547  // situations when this may happen and not call it then
2548  if ( msg->message == WM_SYSCHAR )
2549  {
2550  HWND hwndFocus = ::GetFocus();
2551 
2552  // if the currently focused window itself has WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT style,
2553  // ::IsDialogMessage() will also enter an infinite loop, because it will
2554  // recursively check the child windows but not the window itself and so if
2555  // none of the children accepts focus it loops forever (as it only stops
2556  // when it gets back to the window it started from)
2557  //
2558  // while it is very unusual that a window with WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
2559  // style has the focus, it can happen. One such possibility is if
2560  // all windows are either toplevel, wxDialog, wxPanel or static
2561  // controls and no window can actually accept keyboard input.
2562 #if !defined(__WXWINCE__)
2563  if ( ::GetWindowLong(hwndFocus, GWL_EXSTYLE) & WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT )
2564  {
2565  // pessimistic by default
2566  bool canSafelyCallIsDlgMsg = false;
2567  for ( wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator node = GetChildren().GetFirst();
2568  node;
2569  node = node->GetNext() )
2570  {
2571  wxWindow * const win = node->GetData();
2572  if ( win->CanAcceptFocus() &&
2573  !wxHasWindowExStyle(win, WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT) )
2574  {
2575  // it shouldn't hang...
2576  canSafelyCallIsDlgMsg = true;
2577 
2578  break;
2579  }
2580  }
2581 
2582  if ( !canSafelyCallIsDlgMsg )
2583  return false;
2584  }
2585 #endif // !__WXWINCE__
2586 
2587  // ::IsDialogMessage() can enter in an infinite loop when the
2588  // currently focused window is disabled or hidden and its
2589  // parent has WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT style, so don't call it in
2590  // this case
2591  while ( hwndFocus )
2592  {
2593  if ( !::IsWindowEnabled(hwndFocus) ||
2594  !::IsWindowVisible(hwndFocus) )
2595  {
2596  // it would enter an infinite loop if we do this!
2597  return false;
2598  }
2599 
2600  if ( !(::GetWindowLong(hwndFocus, GWL_STYLE) & WS_CHILD) )
2601  {
2602  // it's a top level window, don't go further -- e.g. even
2603  // if the parent of a dialog is disabled, this doesn't
2604  // break navigation inside the dialog
2605  break;
2606  }
2607 
2608  hwndFocus = ::GetParent(hwndFocus);
2609  }
2610  }
2611 
2612  return ::IsDialogMessage(GetHwnd(), msg) != 0;
2613 }
2614 
2615 #endif // __WXUNIVERSAL__

2664 // Hook for new window just as it's being created, when the window isn't yet
2665 // associated with the handle
2666 static wxWindowMSW *gs_winBeingCreated = NULL;
2667 
2668 // implementation of wxWindowCreationHook class: it just sets gs_winBeingCreated to the
2669 // window being created and insures that it's always unset back later
2670 wxWindowCreationHook::wxWindowCreationHook(wxWindowMSW *winBeingCreated)
2671 {
2672  gs_winBeingCreated = winBeingCreated;
2673 }
2674 
2675 wxWindowCreationHook::~wxWindowCreationHook()
2676 {
2677  gs_winBeingCreated = NULL;
2678 }
2679 
2680 // Main window proc
2681 LRESULT WXDLLEXPORT APIENTRY _EXPORT wxWndProc(HWND hWnd, UINT message, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
2682 {
2683  // trace all messages: useful for the debugging but noticeably slows down
2684  // the code so don't do it by default
2685 #if wxDEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
2686  // notice that we cast wParam and lParam to long to avoid mismatch with
2687  // format specifiers in 64 bit builds where they are both int64 quantities
2688  //
2689  // casting like this loses information, of course, but it shouldn't matter
2690  // much for this diagnostic code and it keeps the code simple
2691  wxLogTrace("winmsg",
2692  wxT("Processing %s(hWnd=%p, wParam=%08lx, lParam=%08lx)"),
2693  wxGetMessageName(message), hWnd, (long)wParam, (long)lParam);
2694 #endif // wxDEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
2695 
2696  wxWindowMSW *wnd = wxFindWinFromHandle(hWnd);
2697 
2698  // when we get the first message for the HWND we just created, we associate
2699  // it with wxWindow stored in gs_winBeingCreated
2700  if ( !wnd && gs_winBeingCreated )
2701  {
2702  wxAssociateWinWithHandle(hWnd, gs_winBeingCreated);
2703  wnd = gs_winBeingCreated;
2704  gs_winBeingCreated = NULL;
2705  wnd->SetHWND((WXHWND)hWnd);
2706  }
2707 
2708  LRESULT rc;
2709 
2710  if ( wnd && wxGUIEventLoop::AllowProcessing(wnd) )
2711  rc = wnd->MSWWindowProc(message, wParam, lParam);
2712  else
2713  rc = ::DefWindowProc(hWnd, message, wParam, lParam);
2714 
2715  return rc;
2716 }
2717 
2718 bool
2719 wxWindowMSW::MSWHandleMessage(WXLRESULT *result,
2720  WXUINT message,
2721  WXWPARAM wParam,
2722  WXLPARAM lParam)
2723 {
2724  // did we process the message?
2725  bool processed = false;
2726 
2727  // the return value
2728  union
2729  {
2730  bool allow;
2731  WXLRESULT result;
2732  WXHBRUSH hBrush;
2733  } rc;
2734 
2735  // for most messages we should return 0 when we do process the message
2736  rc.result = 0;
2737 
2738  switch ( message )
2739  {
2740  case WM_CREATE:
2741  {
2742  bool mayCreate;
2743  processed = HandleCreate((WXLPCREATESTRUCT)lParam, &mayCreate);
2744  if ( processed )
2745  {
2746  // return 0 to allow window creation
2747  rc.result = mayCreate ? 0 : -1;
2748  }
2749  }
2750  break;
2751 
2752  case WM_DESTROY:
2753  // never set processed to true and *always* pass WM_DESTROY to
2754  // DefWindowProc() as Windows may do some internal cleanup when
2755  // processing it and failing to pass the message along may cause
2756  // memory and resource leaks!
2757  (void)HandleDestroy();
2758  break;
2759 
2760  case WM_SIZE:
2761  processed = HandleSize(LOWORD(lParam), HIWORD(lParam), wParam);
2762  break;
2763 
2764  case WM_MOVE:
2765  processed = HandleMove(GET_X_LPARAM(lParam), GET_Y_LPARAM(lParam));
2766  break;
2767 
2768 #if !defined(__WXWINCE__)
2769  case WM_MOVING:
2770  {
2771  LPRECT pRect = (LPRECT)lParam;
2772  wxRect rc;
2773  rc.SetLeft(pRect->left);
2774  rc.SetTop(pRect->top);
2775  rc.SetRight(pRect->right);
2776  rc.SetBottom(pRect->bottom);
2777  processed = HandleMoving(rc);
2778  if (processed) {
2779  pRect->left = rc.GetLeft();
2780  pRect->top = rc.GetTop();
2781  pRect->right = rc.GetRight();
2782  pRect->bottom = rc.GetBottom();
2783  }
2784  }
2785  break;
2786 
2787  case WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE:
2788  {
2789  processed = HandleEnterSizeMove();
2790  }
2791  break;
2792 
2793  case WM_EXITSIZEMOVE:
2794  {
2795  processed = HandleExitSizeMove();
2796  }
2797  break;
2798 
2799  case WM_SIZING:
2800  {
2801  LPRECT pRect = (LPRECT)lParam;
2802  wxRect rc;
2803  rc.SetLeft(pRect->left);

3479  // handle menu chars for ownerdrawn menu items
3480  int i = HandleMenuChar(toupper(LOWORD(wParam)), lParam);
3481  if ( i != wxNOT_FOUND )
3482  {
3483  rc.result = MAKELRESULT(i, MNC_EXECUTE);
3484  processed = true;
3485  }
3486  }
3487  break;
3488 
3489 #if !defined(__WXMICROWIN__) && !defined(__WXWINCE__)
3490  case WM_INITMENUPOPUP:
3491  case WM_MENUSELECT:
3492  case WM_EXITMENULOOP:
3493  case WM_UNINITMENUPOPUP:
3494  {
3495  // Contrary to MSDN implications, at least some of these messages are
3496  // not actually sent to the TLW for popup menus, but to the owning
3497  // window or even its parent window.
3498  //
3499  // wx-3.1+ handles these messages in wxWindow instead, but binary
3500  // compatibility requirements on wx-3.0 make it simpler to just forward
3501  // the messages to the wxTLW.
3502  wxWindow *tlw = wxGetTopLevelParent(this);
3503  if (tlw && tlw != this)
3504  {
3505  rc.result = tlw->MSWWindowProc(message, wParam, lParam);
3506  processed = rc.result == 0;
3507  }
3508  }
3509  break;
3510 #endif // !__WXMICROWIN__
3511 #endif // wxUSE_MENUS
3512 
3513 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
3514  case WM_POWERBROADCAST:
3515  {
3516  bool vetoed;
3517  processed = HandlePower(wParam, lParam, &vetoed);
3518  rc.result = processed && vetoed ? BROADCAST_QUERY_DENY : TRUE;
3519  }
3520  break;
3521 #endif // __WXWINCE__
3522 
3523 #if wxUSE_UXTHEME
3524  // If we want the default themed border then we need to draw it ourselves
3525  case WM_NCCALCSIZE:
3526  {
3527  wxUxThemeEngine* theme = wxUxThemeEngine::GetIfActive();
3528  const wxBorder border = TranslateBorder(GetBorder());
3529  if (theme && border == wxBORDER_THEME)
3530  {
3531  // first ask the widget to calculate the border size
3532  rc.result = MSWDefWindowProc(message, wParam, lParam);
3533  processed = true;
3534 
3535  // now alter the client size making room for drawing a
3536  // themed border
3537  RECT *rect;
3538  NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS *csparam = NULL;
3539  if ( wParam )
3540  {
3541  csparam = (NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS *)lParam;
3542  rect = &csparam->rgrc[0];
3543  }
3544  else
3545  {
3546  rect = (RECT *)lParam;
3547  }
3548 
3549  wxUxThemeHandle hTheme((const wxWindow *)this, L"EDIT");
3550  RECT rcClient = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
3551  wxClientDC dc((wxWindow *)this);
3552  wxMSWDCImpl *impl = (wxMSWDCImpl*) dc.GetImpl();
3553 
3554  if ( theme->GetThemeBackgroundContentRect
3555  (
3556  hTheme,
3557  GetHdcOf(*impl),
3558  EP_EDITTEXT,
3559  ETS_NORMAL,
3560  rect,
3561  &rcClient) == S_OK )
3562  {
3563  InflateRect(&rcClient, -1, -1);
3564  if (wParam)
3565  csparam->rgrc[0] = rcClient;
3566  else
3567  *((RECT*)lParam) = rcClient;
3568 
3569  // WVR_REDRAW triggers a bug whereby child windows are moved up and left,
3570  // so don't use.
3571  // rc.result = WVR_REDRAW;
3572  }
3573  }
3574  }
3575  break;
3576 
3577  case WM_NCPAINT:
3578  {
3579  wxUxThemeEngine* theme = wxUxThemeEngine::GetIfActive();
3580  const wxBorder border = TranslateBorder(GetBorder());
3581  if (theme && border == wxBORDER_THEME)
3582  {
3583  // first ask the widget to paint its non-client area, such as scrollbars, etc.
3584  rc.result = MSWDefWindowProc(message, wParam, lParam);
3585  processed = true;
3586 
3587  wxUxThemeHandle hTheme((const wxWindow *)this, L"EDIT");
3588  wxWindowDC dc((wxWindow *)this);
3589  wxMSWDCImpl *impl = (wxMSWDCImpl*) dc.GetImpl();
3590 
3591  // Clip the DC so that you only draw on the non-client area
3592  RECT rcBorder;
3593  wxCopyRectToRECT(GetSize(), rcBorder);
3594 
3595  RECT rcClient;
3596  theme->GetThemeBackgroundContentRect(
3597  hTheme, GetHdcOf(*impl), EP_EDITTEXT, ETS_NORMAL, &rcBorder, &rcClient);
3598  InflateRect(&rcClient, -1, -1);
3599 
3600  ::ExcludeClipRect(GetHdcOf(*impl), rcClient.left, rcClient.top,
3601  rcClient.right, rcClient.bottom);
3602 
3603  // Make sure the background is in a proper state
3604  if (theme->IsThemeBackgroundPartiallyTransparent(hTheme, EP_EDITTEXT, ETS_NORMAL))
3605  {
3606  theme->DrawThemeParentBackground(GetHwnd(), GetHdcOf(*impl), &rcBorder);
3607  }
3608 
3609  // Draw the border
3610  int nState;
3611  if ( !IsEnabled() )
3612  nState = ETS_DISABLED;
3613  // should we check this?
3614  //else if ( ::GetWindowLong(GetHwnd(), GWL_STYLE) & ES_READONLY)
3615  // nState = ETS_READONLY;
3616  else
3617  nState = ETS_NORMAL;
3618  theme->DrawThemeBackground(hTheme, GetHdcOf(*impl), EP_EDITTEXT, nState, &rcBorder, NULL);
3619  }
3620  }
3621  break;
3622 
3623 #endif // wxUSE_UXTHEME
3624 
3625  default:
3626  // try a custom message handler
3627  const MSWMessageHandlers::const_iterator
3628  i = gs_messageHandlers.find(message);
3629  if ( i != gs_messageHandlers.end() )
3630  {
3631  processed = (*i->second)(this, message, wParam, lParam);
3632  }
3633  }
3634 
3635  if ( !processed )
3636  return false;
3637 
3638  *result = rc.result;
3639 
3640  return true;
3641 }
3642 
3643 WXLRESULT wxWindowMSW::MSWWindowProc(WXUINT message, WXWPARAM wParam, WXLPARAM lParam)
3644 {
3645  WXLRESULT result;
3646  if ( !MSWHandleMessage(&result, message, wParam, lParam) )
3647  {
3648 #if wxDEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
3649  wxLogTrace("winmsg", wxT("Forwarding %s to DefWindowProc."),
3650  wxGetMessageName(message));
3651 #endif // wxDEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
3652  result = MSWDefWindowProc(message, wParam, lParam);
3653  }
3654 
3655  return result;
3656 }

3668 void wxAssociateWinWithHandle(HWND hwnd, wxWindowMSW *win)
3669 {
3670  // adding NULL hwnd is (first) surely a result of an error and
3671  // (secondly) breaks menu command processing
3672  wxCHECK_RET( hwnd != (HWND)NULL,
3673  wxT("attempt to add a NULL hwnd to window list ignored") );
3674 
3675 #if wxDEBUG_LEVEL
3676  WindowHandles::const_iterator i = gs_windowHandles.find(hwnd);
3677  if ( i != gs_windowHandles.end() )
3678  {
3679  if ( i->second != win )
3680  {
3681  wxFAIL_MSG(
3682  wxString::Format(
3683  wxT("HWND %p already associated with another window (%s)"),
3684  hwnd, win->GetClassInfo()->GetClassName()
3685  )
3686  );
3687  }
3688  //else: this actually happens currently because we associate the window
3689  // with its HWND during creation (if we create it) and also when
3690  // SubclassWin() is called later, this is ok
3691  }
3692 #endif // wxDEBUG_LEVEL
3693 
3694  gs_windowHandles[hwnd] = (wxWindow *)win;
3695 }

3711 
3712 void wxWindowMSW::MSWGetCreateWindowCoords(const wxPoint& pos,
3713  const wxSize& size,
3714  int& x, int& y,
3715  int& w, int& h) const
3716 {
3717  // CW_USEDEFAULT can't be used for child windows so just position them at
3718  // the origin by default
3719  x = pos.x == wxDefaultCoord ? 0 : pos.x;
3720  y = pos.y == wxDefaultCoord ? 0 : pos.y;
3721 
3722  AdjustForParentClientOrigin(x, y);
3723 
3724  // We don't have any clearly good choice for the size by default neither
3725  // but we must use something non-zero.
3726  w = WidthDefault(size.x);
3727  h = HeightDefault(size.y);
3728 
3729  /*
3730  NB: there used to be some code here which set the initial size of the
3731  window to the client size of the parent if no explicit size was
3732  specified. This was wrong because wxWidgets programs often assume
3733  that they get a WM_SIZE (EVT_SIZE) upon creation, however this broke
3734  it. To see why, you should understand that Windows sends WM_SIZE from
3735  inside ::CreateWindow() anyhow. However, ::CreateWindow() is called
3736  from some base class ctor and so this WM_SIZE is not processed in the
3737  real class' OnSize() (because it's not fully constructed yet and the
3738  event goes to some base class OnSize() instead). So the WM_SIZE we
3739  rely on is the one sent when the parent frame resizes its children
3740  but here is the problem: if the child already has just the right
3741  size, nothing will happen as both wxWidgets and Windows check for
3742  this and ignore any attempts to change the window size to the size it
3743  already has - so no WM_SIZE would be sent.
3744  */
3745 }
3746 
3747 WXHWND wxWindowMSW::MSWGetParent() const
3748 {
3749  return m_parent ? m_parent->GetHWND() : WXHWND(NULL);
3750 }
3751 
3752 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWCreate(const wxChar *wclass,
3753  const wxChar *title,
3754  const wxPoint& pos,
3755  const wxSize& size,
3756  WXDWORD style,
3757  WXDWORD extendedStyle)
3758 {
3759  // check a common bug in the user code: if the window is created with a
3760  // non-default ctor and Create() is called too, we'd create 2 HWND for a
3761  // single wxWindow object and this results in all sorts of trouble,
3762  // especially for wxTLWs
3763  wxCHECK_MSG( !m_hWnd, true, "window can't be recreated" );
3764 
3765  // this can happen if this function is called using the return value of
3766  // wxApp::GetRegisteredClassName() which failed
3767  wxCHECK_MSG( wclass, false, "failed to register window class?" );
3768 
3769 
3770  // choose the position/size for the new window
3771  int x, y, w, h;
3772  (void)MSWGetCreateWindowCoords(pos, size, x, y, w, h);
3773 
3774  // controlId is menu handle for the top level windows, so set it to 0
3775  // unless we're creating a child window
3776  int controlId = style & WS_CHILD ? GetId() : 0;
3777 
3778  // for each class "Foo" we have we also have "FooNR" ("no repaint") class
3779  // which is the same but without CS_[HV]REDRAW class styles so using it
3780  // ensures that the window is not fully repainted on each resize
3781  wxString className(wclass);
3782  if ( !HasFlag(wxFULL_REPAINT_ON_RESIZE) )
3783  {
3784  className += wxApp::GetNoRedrawClassSuffix();
3785  }
3786 
3787  // do create the window
3788  wxWindowCreationHook hook(this);
3789 
3790  m_hWnd = (WXHWND)::CreateWindowEx
3791  (
3792  extendedStyle,
3793  className.t_str(),
3794  title ? title : m_windowName.t_str(),
3795  style,
3796  x, y, w, h,
3797  (HWND)MSWGetParent(),
3798  (HMENU)wxUIntToPtr(controlId),
3799  wxGetInstance(),
3800  NULL // no extra data
3801  );
3802 
3803  if ( !m_hWnd )
3804  {
3805  wxLogSysError(_("Can't create window of class %s"), className.c_str());
3806 
3807  return false;
3808  }
3809 
3810  SubclassWin(m_hWnd);
3811 
3812  return true;
3813 }

3823 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleNotify(int idCtrl, WXLPARAM lParam, WXLPARAM *result)
3824 {
3825 #ifndef __WXMICROWIN__
3826  LPNMHDR hdr = (LPNMHDR)lParam;
3827  HWND hWnd = hdr->hwndFrom;
3828  wxWindow *win = wxFindWinFromHandle(hWnd);
3829 
3830  // if the control is one of our windows, let it handle the message itself
3831  if ( win )
3832  {
3833  return win->MSWOnNotify(idCtrl, lParam, result);
3834  }
3835 
3836  // VZ: why did we do it? normally this is unnecessary and, besides, it
3837  // breaks the message processing for the toolbars because the tooltip
3838  // notifications were being forwarded to the toolbar child controls
3839  // (if it had any) before being passed to the toolbar itself, so in my
3840  // example the tooltip for the combobox was always shown instead of the
3841  // correct button tooltips
3842 #if 0
3843  // try all our children
3844  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator node = GetChildren().GetFirst();
3845  while ( node )
3846  {
3847  wxWindow *child = node->GetData();
3848  if ( child->MSWOnNotify(idCtrl, lParam, result) )
3849  {
3850  return true;
3851  }
3852 
3853  node = node->GetNext();
3854  }
3855 #endif // 0
3856 
3857  // by default, handle it ourselves
3858  return MSWOnNotify(idCtrl, lParam, result);
3859 #else // __WXMICROWIN__
3860  return false;
3861 #endif
3862 }
3863 
3864 #if wxUSE_TOOLTIPS
3865 
3866 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleTooltipNotify(WXUINT code,
3867  WXLPARAM lParam,
3868  const wxString& ttip)
3869 {
3870  // I don't know why it happens, but the versions of comctl32.dll starting
3871  // from 4.70 sometimes send TTN_NEEDTEXTW even to ANSI programs (normally,
3872  // this message is supposed to be sent to Unicode programs only) -- hence
3873  // we need to handle it as well, otherwise no tooltips will be shown in
3874  // this case
3875 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
3876  if ( !(code == (WXUINT) TTN_NEEDTEXTA || code == (WXUINT) TTN_NEEDTEXTW)
3877  || ttip.empty() )
3878  {
3879  // not a tooltip message or no tooltip to show anyhow
3880  return false;
3881  }
3882 #endif
3883 
3884  LPTOOLTIPTEXT ttText = (LPTOOLTIPTEXT)lParam;
3885 
3886  // We don't want to use the szText buffer because it has a limit of 80
3887  // bytes and this is not enough, especially for Unicode build where it
3888  // limits the tooltip string length to only 40 characters
3889  //
3890  // The best would be, of course, to not impose any length limitations at
3891  // all but then the buffer would have to be dynamic and someone would have
3892  // to free it and we don't have the tooltip owner object here any more, so
3893  // for now use our own static buffer with a higher fixed max length.
3894  //
3895  // Note that using a static buffer should not be a problem as only a single
3896  // tooltip can be shown at the same time anyhow.
3897 #if !wxUSE_UNICODE
3898  if ( code == (WXUINT) TTN_NEEDTEXTW )
3899  {
3900  // We need to convert tooltip from multi byte to Unicode on the fly.
3901  static wchar_t buf[513];
3902 
3903  // Truncate tooltip length if needed as otherwise we might not have
3904  // enough space for it in the buffer and MultiByteToWideChar() would
3905  // return an error
3906  size_t tipLength = wxMin(ttip.length(), WXSIZEOF(buf) - 1);
3907 
3908  // Convert to WideChar without adding the NULL character. The NULL
3909  // character is added afterwards (this is more efficient).
3910  int len = ::MultiByteToWideChar
3911  (
3912  CP_ACP,
3913  0, // no flags
3914  ttip.t_str(),
3915  tipLength,
3916  buf,
3917  WXSIZEOF(buf) - 1
3918  );
3919 
3920  if ( !len )
3921  {
3922  wxLogLastError(wxT("MultiByteToWideChar()"));
3923  }
3924 
3925  buf[len] = L'\0';
3926  ttText->lpszText = (LPSTR) buf;
3927  }
3928  else // TTN_NEEDTEXTA
3929 #endif // !wxUSE_UNICODE
3930  {
3931  // we get here if we got TTN_NEEDTEXTA (only happens in ANSI build) or
3932  // if we got TTN_NEEDTEXTW in Unicode build: in this case we just have
3933  // to copy the string we have into the buffer
3934  static wxChar buf[513];
3935  wxStrlcpy(buf, ttip.c_str(), WXSIZEOF(buf));
3936  ttText->lpszText = buf;
3937  }
3938 
3939  return true;
3940 }
3941 
3942 #endif // wxUSE_TOOLTIPS
3943 
3944 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWOnNotify(int WXUNUSED(idCtrl),
3945  WXLPARAM lParam,
3946  WXLPARAM* WXUNUSED(result))
3947 {
3948 #if wxUSE_TOOLTIPS
3949  if ( m_tooltip )
3950  {
3951  NMHDR* hdr = (NMHDR *)lParam;
3952  if ( HandleTooltipNotify(hdr->code, lParam, m_tooltip->GetTip()))
3953  {
3954  // processed
3955  return true;
3956  }
3957  }
3958 #else
3959  wxUnusedVar(lParam);
3960 #endif // wxUSE_TOOLTIPS
3961 
3962  return false;
3963 }

3969 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleQueryEndSession(long logOff, bool *mayEnd)
3970 {
