3972  wxCloseEvent event(wxEVT_QUERY_END_SESSION, wxID_ANY);
3973  event.SetEventObject(wxTheApp);
3974  event.SetCanVeto(true);
3975  event.SetLoggingOff(logOff == (long)ENDSESSION_LOGOFF);
3976 
3977  bool rc = wxTheApp->ProcessEvent(event);
3978 
3979  if ( rc )
3980  {
3981  // we may end only if the app didn't veto session closing (double
3982  // negation...)
3983  *mayEnd = !event.GetVeto();
3984  }
3985 
3986  return rc;
3987 #else
3988  wxUnusedVar(logOff);
3989  wxUnusedVar(mayEnd);
3990  return false;
3991 #endif
3992 }

3994 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleEndSession(bool endSession, long logOff)
3995 {
3996 #ifdef ENDSESSION_LOGOFF
3997  // do nothing if the session isn't ending
3998  if ( !endSession )
3999  return false;
4000 
4001  // only send once
4002  if ( (this != wxTheApp->GetTopWindow()) )
4003  return false;
4004 
4005  wxCloseEvent event(wxEVT_END_SESSION, wxID_ANY);
4006  event.SetEventObject(wxTheApp);
4007  event.SetCanVeto(false);
4008  event.SetLoggingOff((logOff & ENDSESSION_LOGOFF) != 0);
4009

4011 #else
4012  wxUnusedVar(endSession);

4073 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleSetFocus(WXHWND hwnd)
4074 {
4075  // Strangly enough, some controls get set focus events when they are being
4076  // deleted, even if they already had focus before.
4077  if ( m_isBeingDeleted )
4078  {
4079  return false;
4080  }
4081 
4082  // notify the parent keeping track of focus for the kbd navigation
4083  // purposes that we got it
4084  wxChildFocusEvent eventFocus((wxWindow *)this);
4085  (void)HandleWindowEvent(eventFocus);
4086 
4087 #if wxUSE_CARET
4088  // Deal with caret
4089  if ( m_caret )
4090  {
4091  m_caret->OnSetFocus();
4092  }
4093 #endif // wxUSE_CARET
4094 
4095  wxFocusEvent event(wxEVT_SET_FOCUS, m_windowId);
4096  event.SetEventObject(this);
4097 
4098  // wxFindWinFromHandle() may return NULL, it is ok
4099  event.SetWindow(wxFindWinFromHandle(hwnd));
4100 
4101  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
4102 }

4104 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleKillFocus(WXHWND hwnd)
4105 {
4106 #if wxUSE_CARET
4107  // Deal with caret
4108  if ( m_caret )
4109  {
4110  m_caret->OnKillFocus();
4111  }
4112 #endif // wxUSE_CARET
4113 
4114  // Don't send the event when in the process of being deleted. This can
4115  // only cause problems if the event handler tries to access the object.
4116  if ( m_isBeingDeleted )
4117  {
4118  return false;
4119  }
4120 
4121  wxFocusEvent event(wxEVT_KILL_FOCUS, m_windowId);
4122  event.SetEventObject(this);
4123 
4124  // wxFindWinFromHandle() may return NULL, it is ok
4125  event.SetWindow(wxFindWinFromHandle(hwnd));
4126 
4127  return HandleWindowEvent(event);

4138 
4139 wxString wxWindowMSW::GetLabel() const
4140 {

4164 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleDropFiles(WXWPARAM wParam)
4165 {
4166 #if defined (__WXMICROWIN__) || defined(__WXWINCE__)
4167  wxUnusedVar(wParam);
4168  return false;
4169 #else // __WXMICROWIN__
4170  HDROP hFilesInfo = (HDROP) wParam;
4171 
4172  // Get the total number of files dropped
4173  UINT gwFilesDropped = ::DragQueryFile
4174  (
4175  (HDROP)hFilesInfo,
4176  (UINT)-1,
4177  (LPTSTR)0,
4178  (UINT)0
4179  );
4180 
4181  wxString *files = new wxString[gwFilesDropped];
4182  for ( UINT wIndex = 0; wIndex < gwFilesDropped; wIndex++ )
4183  {
4184  // first get the needed buffer length (+1 for terminating NUL)
4185  size_t len = ::DragQueryFile(hFilesInfo, wIndex, NULL, 0) + 1;
4186 
4187  // and now get the file name
4188  ::DragQueryFile(hFilesInfo, wIndex,
4189  wxStringBuffer(files[wIndex], len), len);
4190  }
4191 
4192  wxDropFilesEvent event(wxEVT_DROP_FILES, gwFilesDropped, files);
4193  event.SetEventObject(this);
4194 
4195  POINT dropPoint;
4196  DragQueryPoint(hFilesInfo, (LPPOINT) &dropPoint);
4197  event.m_pos.x = dropPoint.x;
4198  event.m_pos.y = dropPoint.y;
4199 
4200  DragFinish(hFilesInfo);
4201 
4202  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
4203 #endif
4204 }

4206 
4207 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleSetCursor(WXHWND WXUNUSED(hWnd),
4208  short nHitTest,
4209  int WXUNUSED(mouseMsg))
4210 {
4211 #ifndef __WXMICROWIN__
4212  // the logic is as follows:
4213  // 0. if we're busy, set the busy cursor (even for non client elements)
4214  // 1. don't set custom cursor for non client area of enabled windows
4215  // 2. ask user EVT_SET_CURSOR handler for the cursor
4216  // 3. if still no cursor but we're in a TLW, set the global cursor
4217 
4218  HCURSOR hcursor = 0;
4219 
4220  // Check for "business" is complicated by the fact that modal dialogs shown
4221  // while busy cursor is in effect shouldn't show it as they are active and
4222  // accept input from the user, unlike all the other windows.
4223  bool isBusy = false;
4224  if ( wxIsBusy() )
4225  {
4226  wxDialog* const
4227  dlg = wxDynamicCast(wxGetTopLevelParent(this), wxDialog);
4228  if ( !dlg || !dlg->IsModal() )
4229  isBusy = true;
4230  }
4231 
4232  if ( isBusy )
4233  {
4234  hcursor = wxGetCurrentBusyCursor();
4235  }
4236  else // not busy
4237  {
4238  if ( nHitTest != HTCLIENT )
4239  return false;
4240 
4241  // first ask the user code - it may wish to set the cursor in some very
4242  // specific way (for example, depending on the current position)
4243  POINT pt;
4244  wxGetCursorPosMSW(&pt);
4245 
4246  int x = pt.x,
4247  y = pt.y;
4248  ScreenToClient(&x, &y);
4249  wxSetCursorEvent event(x, y);
4250  event.SetId(GetId());
4251  event.SetEventObject(this);
4252 
4253  bool processedEvtSetCursor = HandleWindowEvent(event);
4254  if ( processedEvtSetCursor && event.HasCursor() )
4255  {
4256  hcursor = GetHcursorOf(event.GetCursor());
4257  }
4258 
4259  if ( !hcursor )
4260  {
4261  // the test for processedEvtSetCursor is here to prevent using
4262  // m_cursor if the user code caught EVT_SET_CURSOR() and returned
4263  // nothing from it - this is a way to say that our cursor shouldn't
4264  // be used for this point
4265  if ( !processedEvtSetCursor && m_cursor.IsOk() )
4266  {
4267  hcursor = GetHcursorOf(m_cursor);
4268  }
4269 
4270  if ( !hcursor && !GetParent() )
4271  {
4272  const wxCursor *cursor = wxGetGlobalCursor();
4273  if ( cursor && cursor->IsOk() )
4274  {
4275  hcursor = GetHcursorOf(*cursor);
4276  }
4277  }
4278  }
4279  }
4280 
4281 
4282  if ( hcursor )
4283  {
4284  ::SetCursor(hcursor);
4285 
4286  // cursor set, stop here
4287  return true;
4288  }
4289 #endif // __WXMICROWIN__
4290 
4291  // pass up the window chain
4292  return false;
4293 }

4295 bool wxWindowMSW::HandlePower(WXWPARAM WXUNUSED_IN_WINCE(wParam),
4296  WXLPARAM WXUNUSED(lParam),
4297  bool *WXUNUSED_IN_WINCE(vetoed))
4298 {
4299 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
4300  // FIXME
4301  return false;
4302 #else
4303  wxEventType evtType;
4304  switch ( wParam )
4305  {
4306  case PBT_APMQUERYSUSPEND:
4307  evtType = wxEVT_POWER_SUSPENDING;
4308  break;
4309 
4310  case PBT_APMQUERYSUSPENDFAILED:
4311  evtType = wxEVT_POWER_SUSPEND_CANCEL;
4312  break;
4313 
4314  case PBT_APMSUSPEND:
4315  evtType = wxEVT_POWER_SUSPENDED;
4316  break;
4317 
4318  case PBT_APMRESUMESUSPEND:
4319  evtType = wxEVT_POWER_RESUME;
4320  break;
4321 
4322  default:
4323  wxLogDebug(wxT("Unknown WM_POWERBROADCAST(%d) event"), wParam);
4324  // fall through
4325 
4326  // these messages are currently not mapped to wx events
4327  case PBT_APMQUERYSTANDBY:
4328  case PBT_APMQUERYSTANDBYFAILED:
4329  case PBT_APMSTANDBY:
4330  case PBT_APMRESUMESTANDBY:
4331  case PBT_APMBATTERYLOW:
4332  case PBT_APMPOWERSTATUSCHANGE:
4333  case PBT_APMOEMEVENT:
4334  case PBT_APMRESUMECRITICAL:
4335 #ifdef PBT_APMRESUMEAUTOMATIC
4336  case PBT_APMRESUMEAUTOMATIC:
4337 #endif
4338  evtType = wxEVT_NULL;
4339  break;
4340  }
4341 
4342  // don't handle unknown messages
4343  if ( evtType == wxEVT_NULL )
4344  return false;
4345 
4346  // TODO: notify about PBTF_APMRESUMEFROMFAILURE in case of resume events?
4347 
4348  wxPowerEvent event(evtType);
4349  if ( !HandleWindowEvent(event) )
4350  return false;
4351 
4352  *vetoed = event.IsVetoed();
4353 
4354  return true;
4355 #endif
4356 }

4463 bool
4464 wxWindowMSW::MSWOnMeasureItem(int id, WXMEASUREITEMSTRUCT *itemStruct)
4465 {
4466 #if wxUSE_OWNER_DRAWN && wxUSE_MENUS_NATIVE
4467  // is it a menu item?
4468  MEASUREITEMSTRUCT *pMeasureStruct = (MEASUREITEMSTRUCT *)itemStruct;
4469  if ( id == 0 && pMeasureStruct->CtlType == ODT_MENU )
4470  {
4471  wxMenuItem *pMenuItem = (wxMenuItem *)(pMeasureStruct->itemData);
4472 
4473  // according to Carsten Fuchs the pointer may be NULL under XP if an
4474  // MDI child frame is initially maximized, see this for more info:
4475  // http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.lib.wxwidgets.general/27745
4476  //
4477  // so silently ignore it instead of asserting
4478  if ( !pMenuItem )
4479  return false;
4480 
4481  wxCHECK_MSG( wxDynamicCast(pMenuItem, wxMenuItem),
4482  false, wxT("MSWOnMeasureItem: bad wxMenuItem pointer") );
4483 
4484  size_t w, h;
4485  bool rc = pMenuItem->OnMeasureItem(&w, &h);
4486 
4487  pMeasureStruct->itemWidth = w;
4488  pMeasureStruct->itemHeight = h;
4489 
4490  return rc;
4491  }
4492 
4493  wxControl *item = wxDynamicCast(FindItem(id), wxControl);
4494  if ( item )
4495  {
4496  return item->MSWOnMeasure(itemStruct);
4497  }
4498 #else
4499  wxUnusedVar(id);
4500  wxUnusedVar(itemStruct);
4501 #endif // wxUSE_OWNER_DRAWN && wxUSE_MENUS_NATIVE
4502 
4503  return false;
4504 }

4551 bool wxWindowMSW::HandlePaletteChanged(WXHWND hWndPalChange)
4552 {
4553 #if wxUSE_PALETTE
4554  // same as below except we don't respond to our own messages
4555  if ( hWndPalChange != GetHWND() )
4556  {
4557  // check to see if we our our parents have a custom palette
4558  wxWindowMSW *win = this;
4559  while ( win && !win->HasCustomPalette() )
4560  {
4561  win = win->GetParent();
4562  }
4563 
4564  if ( win && win->HasCustomPalette() )
4565  {
4566  // realize the palette to see whether redrawing is needed
4567  HDC hdc = ::GetDC((HWND) hWndPalChange);
4568  win->m_palette.SetHPALETTE((WXHPALETTE)
4569  ::SelectPalette(hdc, GetHpaletteOf(win->m_palette), FALSE));
4570 
4571  int result = ::RealizePalette(hdc);
4572 
4573  // restore the palette (before releasing the DC)
4574  win->m_palette.SetHPALETTE((WXHPALETTE)
4575  ::SelectPalette(hdc, GetHpaletteOf(win->m_palette), FALSE));
4576  ::RealizePalette(hdc);
4577  ::ReleaseDC((HWND) hWndPalChange, hdc);
4578 
4579  // now check for the need to redraw
4580  if (result > 0)
4581  ::InvalidateRect((HWND) hWndPalChange, NULL, TRUE);
4582  }
4583 
4584  }
4585 #endif // wxUSE_PALETTE
4586 
4587  wxPaletteChangedEvent event(GetId());
4588  event.SetEventObject(this);
4589  event.SetChangedWindow(wxFindWinFromHandle(hWndPalChange));
4590 
4591  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
4592 }

4612 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleSettingChange(WXWPARAM wParam, WXLPARAM lParam)
4613 {
4614  // despite MSDN saying "(This message cannot be sent directly to a window.)"
4615  // we need to send this to child windows (it is only sent to top-level
4616  // windows) so {list,tree}ctrls can adjust their font size if necessary
4617  // this is exactly how explorer does it to enable the font size changes
4618 
4619  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator node = GetChildren().GetFirst();
4620  while ( node )
4621  {
4622  // top-level windows already get this message from the system
4623  wxWindow *win = node->GetData();
4624  if ( !win->IsTopLevel() )
4625  {
4626  ::SendMessage(GetHwndOf(win), WM_SETTINGCHANGE, wParam, lParam);
4627  }
4628 
4629  node = node->GetNext();
4630  }
4631 
4632  // let the system handle it
4633  return false;
4634 }

4636 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleQueryNewPalette()
4637 {
4638 
4639 #if wxUSE_PALETTE
4640  // check to see if we our our parents have a custom palette
4641  wxWindowMSW *win = this;
4642  while (!win->HasCustomPalette() && win->GetParent()) win = win->GetParent();
4643  if (win->HasCustomPalette()) {
4644  /* realize the palette to see whether redrawing is needed */
4645  HDC hdc = ::GetDC((HWND) GetHWND());
4646  win->m_palette.SetHPALETTE( (WXHPALETTE)
4647  ::SelectPalette(hdc, (HPALETTE) win->m_palette.GetHPALETTE(), FALSE) );
4648 
4649  int result = ::RealizePalette(hdc);
4650  /* restore the palette (before releasing the DC) */
4651  win->m_palette.SetHPALETTE( (WXHPALETTE)
4652  ::SelectPalette(hdc, (HPALETTE) win->m_palette.GetHPALETTE(), TRUE) );
4653  ::RealizePalette(hdc);
4654  ::ReleaseDC((HWND) GetHWND(), hdc);
4655  /* now check for the need to redraw */

4657  ::InvalidateRect((HWND) GetHWND(), NULL, TRUE);
4658  }
4659 #endif // wxUSE_PALETTE
4660

4667 // Responds to colour changes: passes event on to children.
4668 void wxWindowMSW::OnSysColourChanged(wxSysColourChangedEvent& WXUNUSED(event))
4669 {
4670  // the top level window also reset the standard colour map as it might have
4671  // changed (there is no need to do it for the non top level windows as we
4672  // only have to do it once)
4673  if ( IsTopLevel() )
4674  {
4675  // FIXME-MT
4676  gs_hasStdCmap = false;
4677  }
4678  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator node = GetChildren().GetFirst();
4679  while ( node )
4680  {
4681  // Only propagate to non-top-level windows because Windows already
4682  // sends this event to all top-level ones
4683  wxWindow *win = node->GetData();
4684  if ( !win->IsTopLevel() )
4685  {
4686  // we need to send the real WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE and not just trigger
4687  // EVT_SYS_COLOUR_CHANGED call because the latter wouldn't work for
4688  // the standard controls
4689  ::SendMessage(GetHwndOf(win), WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE, 0, 0);
4690  }
4691 
4692  node = node->GetNext();
4693  }
4694 }
4695 
4696 extern wxCOLORMAP *wxGetStdColourMap()
4697 {
4698  static COLORREF s_stdColours[wxSTD_COL_MAX];
4699  static wxCOLORMAP s_cmap[wxSTD_COL_MAX];
4700 
4701  if ( !gs_hasStdCmap )
4702  {
4703  static bool s_coloursInit = false;
4704 
4705  if ( !s_coloursInit )
4706  {
4707  // When a bitmap is loaded, the RGB values can change (apparently
4708  // because Windows adjusts them to care for the old programs always
4709  // using 0xc0c0c0 while the transparent colour for the new Windows
4710  // versions is different). But we do this adjustment ourselves so
4711  // we want to avoid Windows' "help" and for this we need to have a
4712  // reference bitmap which can tell us what the RGB values change
4713  // to.
4714  wxLogNull logNo; // suppress error if we couldn't load the bitmap
4715  wxBitmap stdColourBitmap(wxT("wxBITMAP_STD_COLOURS"));
4716  if ( stdColourBitmap.IsOk() )
4717  {
4718  // the pixels in the bitmap must correspond to wxSTD_COL_XXX!
4719  wxASSERT_MSG( stdColourBitmap.GetWidth() == wxSTD_COL_MAX,
4720  wxT("forgot to update wxBITMAP_STD_COLOURS!") );
4721 
4722  wxMemoryDC memDC;
4723  memDC.SelectObject(stdColourBitmap);
4724 
4725  wxColour colour;
4726  for ( size_t i = 0; i < WXSIZEOF(s_stdColours); i++ )
4727  {
4728  memDC.GetPixel(i, 0, &colour);
4729  s_stdColours[i] = wxColourToRGB(colour);
4730  }
4731  }
4732  else // wxBITMAP_STD_COLOURS couldn't be loaded
4733  {
4734  s_stdColours[0] = RGB(000,000,000); // black
4735  s_stdColours[1] = RGB(128,128,128); // dark grey
4736  s_stdColours[2] = RGB(192,192,192); // light grey
4737  s_stdColours[3] = RGB(255,255,255); // white
4738  //s_stdColours[4] = RGB(000,000,255); // blue
4739  //s_stdColours[5] = RGB(255,000,255); // magenta
4740  }
4741 
4742  s_coloursInit = true;
4743  }
4744 
4745  gs_hasStdCmap = true;
4746 
4747  // create the colour map
4748 #define INIT_CMAP_ENTRY(col) \
4749  s_cmap[wxSTD_COL_##col].from = s_stdColours[wxSTD_COL_##col]; \
4750  s_cmap[wxSTD_COL_##col].to = ::GetSysColor(COLOR_##col)
4751 
4752  INIT_CMAP_ENTRY(BTNTEXT);
4753  INIT_CMAP_ENTRY(BTNSHADOW);
4754  INIT_CMAP_ENTRY(BTNFACE);
4755  INIT_CMAP_ENTRY(BTNHIGHLIGHT);
4756 
4757 #undef INIT_CMAP_ENTRY
4758  }
4759 
4760  return s_cmap;
4761 }
4762 
4763 #if wxUSE_UXTHEME && !defined(TMT_FILLCOLOR)
4764  #define TMT_FILLCOLOR 3802
4765  #define TMT_TEXTCOLOR 3803
4766  #define TMT_BORDERCOLOR 3801
4767 #endif
4768 
4769 wxColour wxWindowMSW::MSWGetThemeColour(const wchar_t *themeName,
4770  int themePart,
4771  int themeState,
4772  MSWThemeColour themeColour,
4773  wxSystemColour fallback) const
4774 {
4775 #if wxUSE_UXTHEME
4776  const wxUxThemeEngine* theme = wxUxThemeEngine::GetIfActive();
4777  if ( theme )
4778  {
4779  int themeProperty = 0;
4780 
4781  // TODO: Convert this into a table? Sure would be faster.
4782  switch ( themeColour )
4783  {
4784  case ThemeColourBackground:
4785  themeProperty = TMT_FILLCOLOR;
4786  break;
4787  case ThemeColourText:
4788  themeProperty = TMT_TEXTCOLOR;
4789  break;
4790  case ThemeColourBorder:
4791  themeProperty = TMT_BORDERCOLOR;
4792  break;
4793  default:
4794  wxFAIL_MSG(wxT("unsupported theme colour"));
4795  };
4796 
4797  wxUxThemeHandle hTheme((const wxWindow *)this, themeName);
4798  COLORREF col;
4799  HRESULT hr = theme->GetThemeColor
4800  (
4801  hTheme,
4802  themePart,
4803  themeState,
4804  themeProperty,
4805  &col
4806  );
4807 
4808  if ( SUCCEEDED(hr) )
4809  return wxRGBToColour(col);
4810 
4811  wxLogApiError(
4812  wxString::Format(
4813  "GetThemeColor(%s, %i, %i, %i)",
4814  themeName, themePart, themeState, themeProperty),
4815  hr);
4816  }
4817 #else
4818  wxUnusedVar(themeName);
4819  wxUnusedVar(themePart);
4820  wxUnusedVar(themeState);
4821  wxUnusedVar(themeColour);
4822 #endif
4823  return wxSystemSettings::GetColour(fallback);
4824 }
4825 
4826 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
4827 // painting
4828 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
4829 
4830 // this variable is used to check that a paint event handler which processed
4831 // the event did create a wxPaintDC inside its code and called BeginPaint() to
4832 // validate the invalidated window area as otherwise we'd keep getting an
4833 // endless stream of WM_PAINT messages for this window resulting in a lot of
4834 // difficult to debug problems (e.g. impossibility to repaint other windows,
4835 // lack of timer and idle events and so on)
4836 extern bool wxDidCreatePaintDC;
4837 bool wxDidCreatePaintDC = false;
4838 
4839 bool wxWindowMSW::HandlePaint()
4840 {
4841  HRGN hRegion = ::CreateRectRgn(0, 0, 0, 0); // Dummy call to get a handle
4842  if ( !hRegion )
4843  {
4844  wxLogLastError(wxT("CreateRectRgn"));
4845  }
4846  if ( ::GetUpdateRgn(GetHwnd(), hRegion, FALSE) == ERROR )
4847  {
4848  wxLogLastError(wxT("GetUpdateRgn"));
4849  }
4850 
4851  m_updateRegion = wxRegion((WXHRGN) hRegion);
4852 
4853  wxDidCreatePaintDC = false;
4854 
4855  wxPaintEvent event(m_windowId);
4856  event.SetEventObject(this);
4857 
4858  bool processed = HandleWindowEvent(event);
4859 
4860  if ( processed && !wxDidCreatePaintDC )
4861  {
4862  // do call MSWDefWindowProc() to validate the update region to avoid
4863  // the problems mentioned above
4864  processed = false;
4865  }
4866 
4867  // note that we must generate NC event after the normal one as otherwise
4868  // BeginPaint() will happily overwrite our decorations with the background
4869  // colour
4870  wxNcPaintEvent eventNc(m_windowId);
4871  eventNc.SetEventObject(this);
4872  HandleWindowEvent(eventNc);
4873 
4874  // don't keep an HRGN we don't need any longer (GetUpdateRegion() can only
4875  // be called from inside the event handlers called above)
4876  m_updateRegion.Clear();
4877 
4878  wxPaintDCImpl::EndPaint((wxWindow *)this);
4879 
4880  return processed;
4881 }
4882 
4883 // Can be called from an application's OnPaint handler
4884 void wxWindowMSW::OnPaint(wxPaintEvent& event)
4885 {
4886 #ifdef __WXUNIVERSAL__
4887  event.Skip();
4888 #else
4889  HDC hDC = (HDC) wxPaintDCImpl::FindDCInCache((wxWindow*) event.GetEventObject());
4890  if (hDC != 0)
4891  {
4892  MSWDefWindowProc(WM_PAINT, (WPARAM) hDC, 0);
4893  }
4894 #endif
4895 }
4896 
4897 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleEraseBkgnd(WXHDC hdc)
4898 {
4899  if ( IsBeingDeleted() )
4900  {
4901  // We can get WM_ERASEBKGND after starting the destruction of our top
4902  // level parent. Handling it in this case is unnecessary and can be
4903  // actually harmful as e.g. wxStaticBox::GetClientSize() doesn't work
4904  // without a valid TLW parent (because it uses dialog units internally
4905  // which use the dialog font), so just don't do anything then.
4906  return false;
4907  }
4908 
4909  switch ( GetBackgroundStyle() )
4910  {
4911  case wxBG_STYLE_ERASE:
4912  case wxBG_STYLE_COLOUR:
4913  // we need to generate an erase background event
4914  {
4915  wxDCTemp dc(hdc, GetClientSize());
4916  wxDCTempImpl *impl = (wxDCTempImpl*) dc.GetImpl();
4917 
4918  impl->SetHDC(hdc);
4919  impl->SetWindow((wxWindow *)this);
4920 
4921  wxEraseEvent event(m_windowId, &dc);
4922  event.SetEventObject(this);
4923  bool rc = HandleWindowEvent(event);
4924 
4925  // must be called manually as ~wxDC doesn't do anything for
4926  // wxDCTemp
4927  impl->SelectOldObjects(hdc);
4928 
4929  if ( rc )
4930  {
4931  // background erased by the user-defined handler
4932  return true;
4933  }
4934  }
4935  // fall through
4936 
4937  case wxBG_STYLE_SYSTEM:
4938  if ( !DoEraseBackground(hdc) )
4939  {
4940  // let the default processing to take place if we didn't erase
4941  // the background ourselves
4942  return false;
4943  }
4944  break;
4945 
4946  case wxBG_STYLE_PAINT:
4947  case wxBG_STYLE_TRANSPARENT:
4948  // no need to do anything here at all, background will be entirely
4949  // redrawn in WM_PAINT handler
4950  break;
4951 
4952  default:
4953  wxFAIL_MSG( "unknown background style" );
4954  }
4955 
4956  return true;
4957 }

4964  != gs_eraseBgHooks.end();

4967 void wxWindowMSW::MSWSetEraseBgHook(wxWindow *child)
4968 {

4970  {
4971  if ( !gs_eraseBgHooks.insert(
4972  EraseBgHooks::value_type(this, child)).second )
4973  {
4974  wxFAIL_MSG( wxT("Setting erase background hook twice?") );
4975  }
4976  }
4977  else // reset the hook
4978  {
4979  if ( gs_eraseBgHooks.erase(this) != 1 )
4980  {
4981  wxFAIL_MSG( wxT("Resetting erase background which was not set?") );
4982  }
4983  }
4984 }

4988 bool wxWindowMSW::DoEraseBackground(WXHDC hDC)
4989 {
4990  HBRUSH hbr = (HBRUSH)MSWGetBgBrush(hDC);
4991  if ( !hbr )
4992  return false;
4993 
4994  // erase just the client area of the window, this is important for the
4995  // frames to avoid drawing over the toolbar part of the window (you might
4996  // think using WS_CLIPCHILDREN would prevent this from happening, but it
4997  // clearly doesn't)
4998  RECT rc;
4999  wxCopyRectToRECT(GetClientRect(), rc);
5000  ::FillRect((HDC)hDC, &rc, hbr);
5001 
5002  return true;
5003 }
5004 
5005 WXHBRUSH
5006 wxWindowMSW::MSWGetBgBrushForChild(WXHDC hDC, wxWindowMSW *child)
5007 {
5008  // Test for the custom background brush first.
5009  WXHBRUSH hbrush = MSWGetCustomBgBrush();
5010  if ( hbrush )
5011  {
5012  // We assume that this is either a stipple or hatched brush and not a
5013  // solid one as otherwise it would have been enough to set the
5014  // background colour and such brushes need to be positioned correctly
5015  // in order to align when different windows are painted, so do it here.
5016  RECT rc;
5017  ::GetWindowRect(GetHwndOf(child), &rc);
5018 
5019  ::MapWindowPoints(NULL, GetHwnd(), (POINT *)&rc, 1);
5020 
5021  int x = rc.left,
5022  y = rc.top;
5023  MSWAdjustBrushOrg(&x, &y);
5024 
5025  if ( !::SetBrushOrgEx((HDC)hDC, -x, -y, NULL) )
5026  {
5027  wxLogLastError(wxT("SetBrushOrgEx(bg brush)"));
5028  }
5029 
5030  return hbrush;
5031  }
5032 
5033  // Otherwise see if we have a custom background colour.
5034  if ( m_hasBgCol )
5035  {
5036  wxBrush *
5037  brush = wxTheBrushList->FindOrCreateBrush(GetBackgroundColour());
5038 
5039  return (WXHBRUSH)GetHbrushOf(*brush);
5040  }
5041 
5042  return 0;
5043 }
5044 
5045 WXHBRUSH wxWindowMSW::MSWGetBgBrush(WXHDC hDC)
5046 {
5047  // Use the special wxWindowBeingErased variable if it is set as the child
5048  // being erased.
5049  wxWindowMSW * const child =
5050 #if wxUSE_UXTHEME
5051  wxWindowBeingErased ? wxWindowBeingErased :
5052 #endif
5053  this;
5054 
5055  for ( wxWindowMSW *win = this; win; win = win->GetParent() )
5056  {
5057  WXHBRUSH hBrush = win->MSWGetBgBrushForChild(hDC, child);
5058  if ( hBrush )
5059  return hBrush;
5060 
5061  // don't use the parent background if we're not transparent
5062  if ( !win->HasTransparentBackground() )
5063  break;
5064 
5065  // background is not inherited beyond top level windows
5066  if ( win->IsTopLevel() )
5067  break;
5068  }
5069 
5070  return 0;
5071 }
5072 
5073 bool wxWindowMSW::HandlePrintClient(WXHDC hDC)
5074 {
5075  // we receive this message when DrawThemeParentBackground() is
5076  // called from def window proc of several controls under XP and we
5077  // must draw properly themed background here
5078  //
5079  // note that naively I'd expect filling the client rect with the
5080  // brush returned by MSWGetBgBrush() work -- but for some reason it
5081  // doesn't and we have to call parents MSWPrintChild() which is
5082  // supposed to call DrawThemeBackground() with appropriate params
5083  //
5084  // also note that in this case lParam == PRF_CLIENT but we're
5085  // clearly expected to paint the background and nothing else!
5086 
5087  if ( IsTopLevel() || InheritsBackgroundColour() )
5088  return false;
5089 
5090  // sometimes we don't want the parent to handle it at all, instead
5091  // return whatever value this window wants
5092  if ( !MSWShouldPropagatePrintChild() )
5093  return MSWPrintChild(hDC, (wxWindow *)this);
5094 
5095  for ( wxWindow *win = GetParent(); win; win = win->GetParent() )
5096  {
5097  if ( win->MSWPrintChild(hDC, (wxWindow *)this) )
5098  return true;
5099 
5100  if ( win->IsTopLevel() || win->InheritsBackgroundColour() )
5101  break;
5102  }
5103 
5104  return false;
5105 }

5165 bool wxWindowMSW::BeginRepositioningChildren()
5166 {
5167 #if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
5168  int numChildren = 0;
5169  for ( HWND child = ::GetWindow(GetHwndOf(this), GW_CHILD);
5170  child;
5171  child = ::GetWindow(child, GW_HWNDNEXT) )
5172  {
5173  numChildren ++;
5174  }
5175 
5176  // Nothing is gained by deferring the repositioning of a single child.
5177  if ( numChildren < 2 )
5178  return false;
5179 
5180  // Protect against valid m_hDWP being overwritten
5181  if ( m_hDWP )
5182  return false;
5183 
5184  m_hDWP = (WXHANDLE)::BeginDeferWindowPos(numChildren);
5185  if ( !m_hDWP )
5186  {
5187  wxLogLastError(wxT("BeginDeferWindowPos"));
5188  return false;
5189  }
5190 
5191  // Return true to indicate that EndDeferWindowPos() should be called.
5192  return true;
5193 #endif // wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
5194 }
5195 
5196 void wxWindowMSW::EndRepositioningChildren()
5197 {
5198 #if wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
5199  wxASSERT_MSG( m_hDWP, wxS("Shouldn't be called") );
5200 
5201  // reset m_hDWP to NULL so that child windows don't try to use our
5202  // m_hDWP after we call EndDeferWindowPos() on it (this shouldn't
5203  // happen anyhow normally but who knows what weird flow of control we
5204  // may have depending on what the users EVT_SIZE handler does...)
5205  HDWP hDWP = (HDWP)m_hDWP;
5206  m_hDWP = NULL;
5207 
5208  // do put all child controls in place at once
5209  if ( !::EndDeferWindowPos(hDWP) )
5210  {
5211  wxLogLastError(wxT("EndDeferWindowPos"));
5212  }
5213 
5214  // Reset our children's pending pos/size values.
5215  for ( wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator node = GetChildren().GetFirst();
5216  node;
5217  node = node->GetNext() )
5218  {
5219  wxWindowMSW * const child = node->GetData();
5220  child->MSWEndDeferWindowPos();
5221  }
5222 #endif // wxUSE_DEFERRED_SIZING
5223 }
5224 
5225 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleSize(int WXUNUSED(w), int WXUNUSED(h), WXUINT wParam)
5226 {
5227  // when we resize this window, its children are probably going to be
5228  // repositioned as well, prepare to use DeferWindowPos() for them
5229  ChildrenRepositioningGuard repositionGuard(this);
5230 
5231  // update this window size
5232  bool processed = false;
5233  switch ( wParam )
5234  {
5235  default:
5236  wxFAIL_MSG( wxT("unexpected WM_SIZE parameter") );
5237  // fall through nevertheless
5238 
5239  case SIZE_MAXHIDE:
5240  case SIZE_MAXSHOW:
5241  // we're not interested in these messages at all
5242  break;
5243 
5244  case SIZE_MINIMIZED:
5245  processed = HandleMinimize();
5246  break;
5247 
5248  case SIZE_MAXIMIZED:
5249  /* processed = */ HandleMaximize();
5250  // fall through to send a normal size event as well
5251 
5252  case SIZE_RESTORED:
5253  // don't use w and h parameters as they specify the client size
5254  // while according to the docs EVT_SIZE handler is supposed to
5255  // receive the total size
5256  wxSizeEvent event(GetSize(), m_windowId);
5257  event.SetEventObject(this);
5258 
5259  processed = HandleWindowEvent(event);
5260  }
5261 
5262  return processed;
5263 }

5271  if (rc)
5272  rect = event.GetRect();

5318 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5319 // command messages
5320 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5321 
5322 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleCommand(WXWORD id_, WXWORD cmd, WXHWND control)
5323 {
5324  // sign extend to int from short before comparing with the other int ids
5325  int id = (signed short)id_;
5326 
5327 #if wxUSE_MENUS_NATIVE
5328  if ( !cmd && wxCurrentPopupMenu )
5329  {
5330  wxMenu *popupMenu = wxCurrentPopupMenu;
5331  wxCurrentPopupMenu = NULL;
5332 
5333  return popupMenu->MSWCommand(cmd, id);
5334  }
5335 #endif // wxUSE_MENUS_NATIVE
5336 
5337  wxWindow *win = NULL;
5338 
5339  // first try to find it from HWND - this works even with the broken
5340  // programs using the same ids for different controls
5341  if ( control )
5342  {
5343  win = wxFindWinFromHandle(control);
5344  }
5345 
5346  // try the id
5347  if ( !win )
5348  {
5349  win = FindItem(id, control);
5350  }
5351 
5352  if ( win )
5353  {
5354  return win->MSWCommand(cmd, id);
5355  }
5356 
5357  // the messages sent from the in-place edit control used by the treectrl
5358  // for label editing have id == 0, but they should _not_ be treated as menu
5359  // messages (they are EN_XXX ones, in fact) so don't translate anything
5360  // coming from a control to wxEVT_MENU
5361  if ( !control )
5362  {
5363  wxCommandEvent event(wxEVT_MENU, id);
5364  event.SetEventObject(this);
5365  event.SetInt(id);
5366 
5367  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
5368  }
5369  else
5370  {
5371 #if wxUSE_SPINCTRL && !defined(__WXUNIVERSAL__)
5372  // the text ctrl which is logically part of wxSpinCtrl sends WM_COMMAND
5373  // notifications to its parent which we want to reflect back to
5374  // wxSpinCtrl
5375  wxSpinCtrl *spin = wxSpinCtrl::GetSpinForTextCtrl(control);
5376  if ( spin && spin->ProcessTextCommand(cmd, id) )
5377  return true;
5378 #endif // wxUSE_SPINCTRL
5379 
5380 #if wxUSE_CHOICE && defined(__SMARTPHONE__)
5381  // the listbox ctrl which is logically part of wxChoice sends WM_COMMAND
5382  // notifications to its parent which we want to reflect back to
5383  // wxChoice
5384  wxChoice *choice = wxChoice::GetChoiceForListBox(control);
5385  if ( choice && choice->MSWCommand(cmd, id) )
5386  return true;
5387 #endif
5388  }
5389 
5390  return false;
5391 }

5394 // mouse events
5395 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5396 
5397 void wxWindowMSW::InitMouseEvent(wxMouseEvent& event,
5398  int x, int y,
5399  WXUINT flags)
5400 {
5401  // our client coords are not quite the same as Windows ones
5402  wxPoint pt = GetClientAreaOrigin();
5403  event.m_x = x - pt.x;
5404  event.m_y = y - pt.y;
5405 
5406  event.m_shiftDown = (flags & MK_SHIFT) != 0;
5407  event.m_controlDown = (flags & MK_CONTROL) != 0;
5408  event.m_leftDown = (flags & MK_LBUTTON) != 0;
5409  event.m_middleDown = (flags & MK_MBUTTON) != 0;
5410  event.m_rightDown = (flags & MK_RBUTTON) != 0;
5411 #ifdef wxHAS_XBUTTON
5412  event.m_aux1Down = (flags & MK_XBUTTON1) != 0;
5413  event.m_aux2Down = (flags & MK_XBUTTON2) != 0;
5414 #endif // wxHAS_XBUTTON
5415  event.m_altDown = ::wxIsAltDown();
5416 
5417 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
5418  event.SetTimestamp(::GetMessageTime());
5419 #endif
5420 
5421  event.SetEventObject(this);
5422  event.SetId(GetId());
5423 
5424 #if wxUSE_MOUSEEVENT_HACK
5425  gs_lastMouseEvent.pos = ClientToScreen(wxPoint(x, y));
5426  gs_lastMouseEvent.type = event.GetEventType();
5427 #endif // wxUSE_MOUSEEVENT_HACK
5428 }
5429 
5430 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
5431 // Windows doesn't send the mouse events to the static controls (which are
5432 // transparent in the sense that their WM_NCHITTEST handler returns
5433 // HTTRANSPARENT) at all but we want all controls to receive the mouse events
5434 // and so we manually check if we don't have a child window under mouse and if
5435 // we do, send the event to it instead of the window Windows had sent WM_XXX
5436 // to.
5437 //
5438 // Notice that this is not done for the mouse move events because this could
5439 // (would?) be too slow, but only for clicks which means that the static texts
5440 // still don't get move, enter nor leave events.
5441 static wxWindowMSW *FindWindowForMouseEvent(wxWindowMSW *win, int *x, int *y)
5442 {
5443  wxCHECK_MSG( x && y, win, wxT("NULL pointer in FindWindowForMouseEvent") );
5444 
5445  // first try to find a non transparent child: this allows us to send events
5446  // to a static text which is inside a static box, for example
5447  POINT pt = { *x, *y };
5448  HWND hwnd = GetHwndOf(win),
5449  hwndUnderMouse;
5450 
5451 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
5452  hwndUnderMouse = ::ChildWindowFromPoint
5453  (
5454  hwnd,
5455  pt
5456  );
5457 #else
5458  hwndUnderMouse = ::ChildWindowFromPointEx
5459  (
5460  hwnd,
5461  pt,
5462  CWP_SKIPINVISIBLE |
5463  CWP_SKIPDISABLED |
5464  CWP_SKIPTRANSPARENT
5465  );
5466 #endif
5467 
5468  if ( !hwndUnderMouse || hwndUnderMouse == hwnd )
5469  {
5470  // now try any child window at all
5471  hwndUnderMouse = ::ChildWindowFromPoint(hwnd, pt);
5472  }
5473 
5474  // check that we have a child window which is susceptible to receive mouse
5475  // events: for this it must be shown and enabled
5476  if ( hwndUnderMouse &&
5477  hwndUnderMouse != hwnd &&
5478  ::IsWindowVisible(hwndUnderMouse) &&
5479  ::IsWindowEnabled(hwndUnderMouse) )
5480  {
5481  wxWindow *winUnderMouse = wxFindWinFromHandle(hwndUnderMouse);
5482  if ( winUnderMouse )
5483  {
5484  // translate the mouse coords to the other window coords
5485  win->ClientToScreen(x, y);
5486  winUnderMouse->ScreenToClient(x, y);
5487 
5488  win = winUnderMouse;
5489  }
5490  }
5491 
5492  return win;
5493 }
5494 #endif // __WXWINCE__
5495 
5496 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleMouseEvent(WXUINT msg, int x, int y, WXUINT flags)
5497 {
5498  // the mouse events take consecutive IDs from WM_MOUSEFIRST to
5499  // WM_MOUSELAST, so it's enough to subtract WM_MOUSEMOVE == WM_MOUSEFIRST
5500  // from the message id and take the value in the table to get wxWin event
5501  // id
5502  static const wxEventType eventsMouse[] =
5503  {
5504  wxEVT_MOTION,
5505  wxEVT_LEFT_DOWN,
5506  wxEVT_LEFT_UP,
5507  wxEVT_LEFT_DCLICK,
5508  wxEVT_RIGHT_DOWN,
5509  wxEVT_RIGHT_UP,
5510  wxEVT_RIGHT_DCLICK,
5511  wxEVT_MIDDLE_DOWN,
5512  wxEVT_MIDDLE_UP,
5513  wxEVT_MIDDLE_DCLICK,
5514  0, // this one is for wxEVT_MOTION which is not used here
5515  wxEVT_AUX1_DOWN,
5516  wxEVT_AUX1_UP,
5517  wxEVT_AUX1_DCLICK,
5518  wxEVT_AUX2_DOWN,
5519  wxEVT_AUX2_UP,
5520  wxEVT_AUX2_DCLICK
5521  };
5522 
5523 #ifdef wxHAS_XBUTTON
5524  // the same messages are used for both auxiliary mouse buttons so we need
5525  // to adjust the index manually
5526  switch ( msg )
5527  {
5528  case WM_XBUTTONDOWN:
5529  case WM_XBUTTONUP:
5530  case WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK:
5531  if ( flags & MK_XBUTTON2 )
5532  msg += wxEVT_AUX2_DOWN - wxEVT_AUX1_DOWN;
5533  }
5534 #endif // wxHAS_XBUTTON
5535 
5536  wxMouseEvent event(eventsMouse[msg - WM_MOUSEMOVE]);
5537  InitMouseEvent(event, x, y, flags);
5538 
5539  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
5540 }
5541 
5542 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleMouseMove(int x, int y, WXUINT flags)
5543 {
5544  if ( !m_mouseInWindow )
5545  {
5546  // it would be wrong to assume that just because we get a mouse move
5547  // event that the mouse is inside the window: although this is usually
5548  // true, it is not if we had captured the mouse, so we need to check
5549  // the mouse coordinates here
5550  if ( !HasCapture() || IsMouseInWindow() )
5551  {
5552  // Generate an ENTER event
5553  m_mouseInWindow = true;
5554 
5555 #ifdef HAVE_TRACKMOUSEEVENT
5556  typedef BOOL (WINAPI *_TrackMouseEvent_t)(LPTRACKMOUSEEVENT);
5557 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
5558  static const _TrackMouseEvent_t
5559  s_pfn_TrackMouseEvent = _TrackMouseEvent;
5560 #else // !__WXWINCE__
5561  static _TrackMouseEvent_t s_pfn_TrackMouseEvent;
5562  static bool s_initDone = false;
5563  if ( !s_initDone )
5564  {
5565  // see comment in wxApp::GetComCtl32Version() explaining the
5566  // use of wxLoadedDLL
5567  wxLoadedDLL dllComCtl32(wxT("comctl32.dll"));
5568  if ( dllComCtl32.IsLoaded() )
5569  {
5570  s_pfn_TrackMouseEvent = (_TrackMouseEvent_t)
5571  dllComCtl32.RawGetSymbol(wxT("_TrackMouseEvent"));
5572  }
5573 
5574  s_initDone = true;
5575  }
5576 
5577  if ( s_pfn_TrackMouseEvent )
5578 #endif // __WXWINCE__/!__WXWINCE__
5579  {
5580  WinStruct<TRACKMOUSEEVENT> trackinfo;
5581 
5582  trackinfo.dwFlags = TME_LEAVE;
5583  trackinfo.hwndTrack = GetHwnd();
5584 
5585  (*s_pfn_TrackMouseEvent)(&trackinfo);
5586  }
5587 #endif // HAVE_TRACKMOUSEEVENT
5588 
5589  wxMouseEvent event(wxEVT_ENTER_WINDOW);
5590  InitMouseEvent(event, x, y, flags);
5591 
5592  (void)HandleWindowEvent(event);
5593  }
5594  }
5595 #ifdef HAVE_TRACKMOUSEEVENT
5596  else // mouse not in window
5597  {
5598  // Check if we need to send a LEAVE event
5599  // Windows doesn't send WM_MOUSELEAVE if the mouse has been captured so
5600  // send it here if we are using native mouse leave tracking
5601  if ( HasCapture() && !IsMouseInWindow() )
5602  {
5603  GenerateMouseLeave();
5604  }
5605  }
5606 #endif // HAVE_TRACKMOUSEEVENT
5607 
5608 #if wxUSE_MOUSEEVENT_HACK
5609  // Windows often generates mouse events even if mouse position hasn't
5610  // changed (http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.lib.wxwidgets.devel/66576)
5611  //
5612  // Filter this out as it can result in unexpected behaviour compared to
5613  // other platforms
5614  if ( gs_lastMouseEvent.type == wxEVT_RIGHT_DOWN ||
5615  gs_lastMouseEvent.type == wxEVT_LEFT_DOWN ||
5616  gs_lastMouseEvent.type == wxEVT_MIDDLE_DOWN ||
5617  gs_lastMouseEvent.type == wxEVT_MOTION )
5618  {
5619  if ( ClientToScreen(wxPoint(x, y)) == gs_lastMouseEvent.pos )
5620  {
5621  gs_lastMouseEvent.type = wxEVT_MOTION;
5622 
5623  return false;
5624  }
5625  }
5626 #endif // wxUSE_MOUSEEVENT_HACK
5627 
5628  return HandleMouseEvent(WM_MOUSEMOVE, x, y, flags);
5629 }
5630 
5631 
5632 bool
5633 wxWindowMSW::HandleMouseWheel(wxMouseWheelAxis axis,
5634  WXWPARAM wParam, WXLPARAM lParam)
5635 {
5636 #if wxUSE_MOUSEWHEEL
5637  // notice that WM_MOUSEWHEEL position is in screen coords (as it's
5638  // forwarded up to the parent by DefWindowProc()) and not in the client
5639  // ones as all the other messages, translate them to the client coords for
5640  // consistency -- but do it using Windows function and not our own one
5641  // because InitMouseEvent() expects coordinates in Windows client
5642  // coordinates and not wx ones (the difference being the height of the
5643  // toolbar, if any).
5644  POINT pt;
5645  pt.x = GET_X_LPARAM(lParam);
5646  pt.y = GET_Y_LPARAM(lParam);
5647  ::ScreenToClient(GetHwnd(), &pt);
5648 
5649  wxMouseEvent event(wxEVT_MOUSEWHEEL);
5650  InitMouseEvent(event, pt.x, pt.y, LOWORD(wParam));
5651  event.m_wheelRotation = (short)HIWORD(wParam);
5652  event.m_wheelDelta = WHEEL_DELTA;
5653  event.m_wheelAxis = axis;
5654 
5655  static int s_linesPerRotation = -1;
5656  if ( s_linesPerRotation == -1 )
5657  {
5658  if ( !::SystemParametersInfo(SPI_GETWHEELSCROLLLINES, 0,
5659  &s_linesPerRotation, 0))
5660  {
5661  // this is not supposed to happen
5662  wxLogLastError(wxT("SystemParametersInfo(GETWHEELSCROLLLINES)"));
5663 
5664  // the default is 3, so use it if SystemParametersInfo() failed
5665  s_linesPerRotation = 3;
5666  }
5667  }
5668 
5669  static int s_columnsPerRotation = -1;
5670  if ( s_columnsPerRotation == -1 )
5671  {
5672  if ( !::SystemParametersInfo(SPI_GETWHEELSCROLLCHARS, 0,
5673  &s_columnsPerRotation, 0))
5674  {
5675  // this setting is not supported on Windows 2000/XP, so use the value of 1
5676  // http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms997498.aspx
5677  s_columnsPerRotation = 1;
5678  }
5679  }
5680 
5681  event.m_linesPerAction = s_linesPerRotation;
5682  event.m_columnsPerAction = s_columnsPerRotation;
5683  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
5684 
5685 #else // !wxUSE_MOUSEWHEEL
5686  wxUnusedVar(wParam);
5687  wxUnusedVar(lParam);
5688 
5689  return false;
5690 #endif // wxUSE_MOUSEWHEEL/!wxUSE_MOUSEWHEEL
5691 }
5692 
5693 void wxWindowMSW::GenerateMouseLeave()
5694 {
5695  m_mouseInWindow = false;
5696 
5697  int state = 0;
5698  if ( wxIsShiftDown() )
5699  state |= MK_SHIFT;
5700  if ( wxIsCtrlDown() )
5701  state |= MK_CONTROL;
5702 
5703  // Only the high-order bit should be tested
5704  if ( GetKeyState( VK_LBUTTON ) & (1<<15) )
5705  state |= MK_LBUTTON;
5706  if ( GetKeyState( VK_MBUTTON ) & (1<<15) )
5707  state |= MK_MBUTTON;
5708  if ( GetKeyState( VK_RBUTTON ) & (1<<15) )
5709  state |= MK_RBUTTON;
5710 
5711  POINT pt;
5712  wxGetCursorPosMSW(&pt);
5713 
5714  // we need to have client coordinates here for symmetry with
5715  // wxEVT_ENTER_WINDOW
5716  RECT rect = wxGetWindowRect(GetHwnd());
5717  pt.x -= rect.left;
5718  pt.y -= rect.top;
5719 
5720  wxMouseEvent event(wxEVT_LEAVE_WINDOW);
5721  InitMouseEvent(event, pt.x, pt.y, state);
5722 
5723  (void)HandleWindowEvent(event);
5724 }

5726 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5727 // keyboard handling
5728 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5729 
5730 namespace
5731 {
5732 
5733 // Implementation of InitAnyKeyEvent() which can also be used when there is no
5734 // associated window: this can happen for the wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK events created by
5735 // the global keyboard hook (e.g. the event might have happened in a non-wx
5736 // window).
5737 void
5738 MSWInitAnyKeyEvent(wxKeyEvent& event,
5739  WXWPARAM wParam,
5740  WXLPARAM lParam,
5741  const wxWindowBase *win /* may be NULL */)
5742 {
5743  if ( win )
5744  {
5745  event.SetId(win->GetId());
5746  event.SetEventObject(const_cast<wxWindowBase *>(win));
5747  }
5748  else // No associated window.
5749  {
5750  // Use wxID_ANY for compatibility with the old code even if wxID_NONE
5751  // would arguably make more sense.
5752  event.SetId(wxID_ANY);
5753  }
5754 
5755  event.m_shiftDown = wxIsShiftDown();
5756  event.m_controlDown = wxIsCtrlDown();
5757  event.m_altDown = (HIWORD(lParam) & KF_ALTDOWN) == KF_ALTDOWN;
5758 
5759  event.m_rawCode = (wxUint32) wParam;
5760  event.m_rawFlags = (wxUint32) lParam;
5761 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
5762  event.SetTimestamp(::GetMessageTime());
5763 #endif
5764 }
5765 
5766 } // anonymous namespace
5767 
5768 void
5769 wxWindowMSW::InitAnyKeyEvent(wxKeyEvent& event,
5770  WXWPARAM wParam,
5771  WXLPARAM lParam) const
5772 {
5773  MSWInitAnyKeyEvent(event, wParam, lParam, this);
5774 }
5775 
5776 wxKeyEvent
5777 wxWindowMSW::CreateKeyEvent(wxEventType evType,
5778  WXWPARAM wParam,
5779  WXLPARAM lParam) const
5780 {
5781  // Catch any attempts to use this with WM_CHAR, it wouldn't work because
5782  // wParam is supposed to be a virtual key and not a character here.
5783  wxASSERT_MSG( evType != wxEVT_CHAR && evType != wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK,
5784  "CreateKeyEvent() can't be used for char events" );
5785 
5786  wxKeyEvent event(evType);
5787  InitAnyKeyEvent(event, wParam, lParam);
5788 
5789  event.m_keyCode = wxMSWKeyboard::VKToWX
5790  (
5791  wParam,
5792  lParam
5793 #if wxUSE_UNICODE
5794  , &event.m_uniChar
5795 #endif // wxUSE_UNICODE
5796  );
5797 
5798  return event;
5799 }
5800 
5801 wxKeyEvent
5802 wxWindowMSW::CreateCharEvent(wxEventType evType,
5803  WXWPARAM wParam,
5804  WXLPARAM lParam) const
5805 {
5806  wxKeyEvent event(evType);
5807  InitAnyKeyEvent(event, wParam, lParam);
5808 
5809 #if wxUSE_UNICODE
5810  // TODO: wParam uses UTF-16 so this is incorrect for characters outside of
5811  // the BMP, we should use WM_UNICHAR to handle them.
5812  event.m_uniChar = wParam;
5813 #endif // wxUSE_UNICODE
5814 
5815  // Set non-Unicode key code too for compatibility if possible.
5816  if ( wParam < 0x80 )
5817  {
5818  // It's an ASCII character, no need to translate it.
5819  event.m_keyCode = wParam;
5820  }
5821  else
5822  {
5823  // Check if this key can be represented (as a single character) in the
5824  // current locale.
5825  const wchar_t wc = wParam;
5826  char ch;
5827  if ( wxConvLibc.FromWChar(&ch, 1, &wc, 1) != wxCONV_FAILED )
5828  {
5829  // For compatibility continue to provide the key code in this field
5830  // even though using GetUnicodeKey() is recommended now.
5831  event.m_keyCode = static_cast<unsigned char>(ch);
5832  }
5833  //else: Key can't be represented in the current locale, leave m_keyCode
5834  // as WXK_NONE and use GetUnicodeKey() to access the character.
5835  }
5836 
5837  // the alphanumeric keys produced by pressing AltGr+something on European
5838  // keyboards have both Ctrl and Alt modifiers which may confuse the user
5839  // code as, normally, keys with Ctrl and/or Alt don't result in anything
5840  // alphanumeric, so pretend that there are no modifiers at all (the
5841  // KEY_DOWN event would still have the correct modifiers if they're really
5842  // needed)
5843  if ( event.m_controlDown && event.m_altDown &&
5844  (event.m_keyCode >= 32 && event.m_keyCode < 256) )
5845  {
5846  event.m_controlDown =
5847  event.m_altDown = false;
5848  }
5849 
5850  return event;
5851 }
5852

5854 // WM_KEYDOWN one
5855 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleChar(WXWPARAM wParam, WXLPARAM lParam)

5857  wxKeyEvent event(CreateCharEvent(wxEVT_CHAR, wParam, lParam));
5858  return HandleWindowEvent(event);

5873 #if wxUSE_MENUS
5874 int wxWindowMSW::HandleMenuChar(int WXUNUSED_IN_WINCE(chAccel),
5875  WXLPARAM WXUNUSED_IN_WINCE(lParam))
5876 {
5877  // FIXME: implement GetMenuItemCount for WinCE, possibly
5878  // in terms of GetMenuItemInfo
5879 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
5880  const HMENU hmenu = (HMENU)lParam;
5881 
5882  WinStruct<MENUITEMINFO> mii;
5883 
5884  // we could use MIIM_FTYPE here as we only need to know if the item is
5885  // ownerdrawn or not and not dwTypeData which MIIM_TYPE also returns, but
5886  // MIIM_FTYPE is not supported under Win95
5887  mii.fMask = MIIM_TYPE | MIIM_DATA;
5888 
5889  // find if we have this letter in any owner drawn item
5890  const int count = ::GetMenuItemCount(hmenu);
5891  for ( int i = 0; i < count; i++ )
5892  {
5893  // previous loop iteration could modify it, reset it back before
5894  // calling GetMenuItemInfo() to prevent it from overflowing dwTypeData
5895  mii.cch = 0;
5896 
5897  if ( ::GetMenuItemInfo(hmenu, i, TRUE, &mii) )
5898  {
5899  if ( mii.fType == MFT_OWNERDRAW )
5900  {
5901  // dwItemData member of the MENUITEMINFO is a
5902  // pointer to the associated wxMenuItem -- see the
5903  // menu creation code
5904  wxMenuItem *item = (wxMenuItem*)mii.dwItemData;
5905 
5906  const wxString label(item->GetItemLabel());
5907  const wxChar *p = wxStrchr(label.t_str(), wxT('&'));
5908  while ( p++ )
5909  {
5910  if ( *p == wxT('&') )
5911  {
5912  // this is not the accel char, find the real one
5913  p = wxStrchr(p + 1, wxT('&'));
5914  }
5915  else // got the accel char
5916  {
5917  // FIXME-UNICODE: this comparison doesn't risk to work
5918  // for non ASCII accelerator characters I'm afraid, but
5919  // what can we do?
5920  if ( (wchar_t)wxToupper(*p) == (wchar_t)chAccel )
5921  {
5922  return i;
5923  }
5924  else
5925  {
5926  // this one doesn't match
5927  break;
5928  }
5929  }
5930  }
5931  }
5932  }
5933  else // failed to get the menu text?
5934  {
5935  // it's not fatal, so don't show error, but still log it
5936  wxLogLastError(wxT("GetMenuItemInfo"));
5937  }
5938  }
5939 #endif
5940  return wxNOT_FOUND;
5941 }
5942 
5943 #endif // wxUSE_MENUS

5960 
5961 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleJoystickEvent(WXUINT msg, int x, int y, WXUINT flags)
5962 {
5963 #ifdef JOY_BUTTON1
5964  int change = 0;
5965  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON1CHG )
5966  change = wxJOY_BUTTON1;
5967  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON2CHG )
5968  change = wxJOY_BUTTON2;
5969  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON3CHG )
5970  change = wxJOY_BUTTON3;
5971  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON4CHG )
5972  change = wxJOY_BUTTON4;
5973 
5974  int buttons = 0;
5975  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON1 )
5976  buttons |= wxJOY_BUTTON1;
5977  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON2 )
5978  buttons |= wxJOY_BUTTON2;
5979  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON3 )
5980  buttons |= wxJOY_BUTTON3;
5981  if ( flags & JOY_BUTTON4 )
5982  buttons |= wxJOY_BUTTON4;
5983 
5984  // the event ids aren't consecutive so we can't use table based lookup
5985  int joystick;
5986  wxEventType eventType;
5987  switch ( msg )
5988  {
5989  case MM_JOY1MOVE:
5990  joystick = 1;
5991  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_MOVE;
5992  break;
5993 
5994  case MM_JOY2MOVE:
5995  joystick = 2;
5996  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_MOVE;
5997  break;
5998 
5999  case MM_JOY1ZMOVE:
6000  joystick = 1;
6001  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_ZMOVE;
6002  break;
6003 
6004  case MM_JOY2ZMOVE:
6005  joystick = 2;
6006  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_ZMOVE;
6007  break;
6008 
6009  case MM_JOY1BUTTONDOWN:
6010  joystick = 1;
6011  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_BUTTON_DOWN;
6012  break;
6013 
6014  case MM_JOY2BUTTONDOWN:
6015  joystick = 2;
6016  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_BUTTON_DOWN;
6017  break;
6018 
6019  case MM_JOY1BUTTONUP:
6020  joystick = 1;
6021  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_BUTTON_UP;
6022  break;
6023 
6024  case MM_JOY2BUTTONUP:
6025  joystick = 2;
6026  eventType = wxEVT_JOY_BUTTON_UP;
6027  break;
6028 
6029  default:
6030  wxFAIL_MSG(wxT("no such joystick event"));
6031 
6032  return false;
6033  }
6034 
6035  wxJoystickEvent event(eventType, buttons, joystick, change);
6036  if ( eventType == wxEVT_JOY_ZMOVE )
6037  event.SetZPosition(x);
6038  else
6039  event.SetPosition(wxPoint(x, y));
6040  event.SetEventObject(this);
6041 
6042  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
6043 #else
6044  wxUnusedVar(msg);
6045  wxUnusedVar(x);
6046  wxUnusedVar(y);
6047  wxUnusedVar(flags);
6048  return false;
6049 #endif
6050 }

6053 // scrolling
6054 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
6055 
6056 bool wxWindowMSW::MSWOnScroll(int orientation, WXWORD wParam,
6057  WXWORD pos, WXHWND control)
6058 {
6059  if ( control && control != m_hWnd ) // Prevent infinite recursion
6060  {
6061  wxWindow *child = wxFindWinFromHandle(control);
6062  if ( child )
6063  return child->MSWOnScroll(orientation, wParam, pos, control);
6064  }
6065 
6066  wxScrollWinEvent event;
6067  event.SetPosition(pos);
6068  event.SetOrientation(orientation);
6069  event.SetEventObject(this);
6070 
6071  switch ( wParam )
6072  {
6073  case SB_TOP:
6074  event.SetEventType(wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_TOP);
6075  break;
6076 
6077  case SB_BOTTOM:
6078  event.SetEventType(wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_BOTTOM);
6079  break;
6080 
6081  case SB_LINEUP:
6082  event.SetEventType(wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_LINEUP);
6083  break;
6084 
6085  case SB_LINEDOWN:
6086  event.SetEventType(wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_LINEDOWN);
6087  break;
6088 
6089  case SB_PAGEUP:
6090  event.SetEventType(wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_PAGEUP);
6091  break;
6092 
6093  case SB_PAGEDOWN:
6094  event.SetEventType(wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_PAGEDOWN);
6095  break;
6096 
6097  case SB_THUMBPOSITION:
6098  case SB_THUMBTRACK:
6099  // under Win32, the scrollbar range and position are 32 bit integers,
6100  // but WM_[HV]SCROLL only carry the low 16 bits of them, so we must
6101  // explicitly query the scrollbar for the correct position (this must
6102  // be done only for these two SB_ events as they are the only one
6103  // carrying the scrollbar position)
6104  {
6105  WinStruct<SCROLLINFO> scrollInfo;
6106  scrollInfo.fMask = SIF_TRACKPOS;
6107 
6108  if ( !::GetScrollInfo(GetHwnd(),
6109  WXOrientToSB(orientation),
6110  &scrollInfo) )
6111  {
6112  // Not necessarily an error, if there are no scrollbars yet.
6113  // wxLogLastError(wxT("GetScrollInfo"));
6114  }
6115 
6116  event.SetPosition(scrollInfo.nTrackPos);
6117  }
6118 
6119  event.SetEventType( wParam == SB_THUMBPOSITION
6120  ? wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_THUMBRELEASE
6121  : wxEVT_SCROLLWIN_THUMBTRACK );
6122  break;
6123 
6124  default:
6125  return false;
6126  }
6127 
6128  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
6129 }

6135 /* static */ bool
6136 wxWindowMSW::MSWRegisterMessageHandler(int msg, MSWMessageHandler handler)
6137 {
6138  wxCHECK_MSG( gs_messageHandlers.find(msg) == gs_messageHandlers.end(),
6139  false, wxT("registering handler for the same message twice") );
6140 
6141  gs_messageHandlers[msg] = handler;
6142  return true;
6143 }
6144 
6145 /* static */ void
6146 wxWindowMSW::MSWUnregisterMessageHandler(int msg, MSWMessageHandler handler)
6147 {
6148  const MSWMessageHandlers::iterator i = gs_messageHandlers.find(msg);
6149  wxCHECK_RET( i != gs_messageHandlers.end() && i->second == handler,
6150  wxT("unregistering non-registered handler?") );
6151 
6152  gs_messageHandlers.erase(i);
6153 }

6159 void wxGetCharSize(WXHWND wnd, int *x, int *y, const wxFont& the_font)
6160 {
6161  TEXTMETRIC tm;
6162  HDC dc = ::GetDC((HWND) wnd);
6163  HFONT was = 0;
6164 
6165  // the_font.UseResource();
6166  // the_font.RealizeResource();
6167  HFONT fnt = (HFONT)the_font.GetResourceHandle(); // const_cast
6168  if ( fnt )
6169  was = (HFONT) SelectObject(dc,fnt);
6170 
6171  GetTextMetrics(dc, &tm);
6172  if ( fnt && was )
6173  {
6174  SelectObject(dc,was);
6175  }
6176  ReleaseDC((HWND)wnd, dc);
6177 
6178  if ( x )
6179  *x = tm.tmAveCharWidth;
6180  if ( y )
6181  *y = tm.tmHeight + tm.tmExternalLeading;
6182 
6183  // the_font.ReleaseResource();
6184 }

6196 // use the "extended" bit of lParam to distinguish extended keys from normal
6197 // keys as the same virtual key code is sent for both by Windows
6198 inline
6199 int ChooseNormalOrExtended(int lParam, int keyNormal, int keyExtended)
6200 {
6201  // except that if lParam is 0, it means we don't have real lParam from
6202  // WM_KEYDOWN but are just translating just a VK constant (e.g. done from
6203  // msw/treectrl.cpp when processing TVN_KEYDOWN) -- then assume this is a
6204  // non-numpad (hence extended) key as this is a more common case
6205  return !lParam || (HIWORD(lParam) & KF_EXTENDED) ? keyExtended : keyNormal;
6206 }
6207 
6208 // this array contains the Windows virtual key codes which map one to one to
6209 // WXK_xxx constants and is used in wxMSWKeyboard::VKToWX/WXToVK() below
6210 //
6211 // note that keys having a normal and numpad version (e.g. WXK_HOME and
6212 // WXK_NUMPAD_HOME) are not included in this table as the mapping is not 1-to-1
6213 const struct wxKeyMapping
6214 {
6215  int vk;
6216  wxKeyCode wxk;
6217 } gs_specialKeys[] =
6218 {

6220  { VK_BACK, WXK_BACK },
6221  { VK_TAB, WXK_TAB },
6222  { VK_CLEAR, WXK_CLEAR },
6223  { VK_SHIFT, WXK_SHIFT },
6224  { VK_CONTROL, WXK_CONTROL },
6225  { VK_MENU , WXK_ALT },
6226  { VK_PAUSE, WXK_PAUSE },
6227  { VK_CAPITAL, WXK_CAPITAL },
6228  { VK_SPACE, WXK_SPACE },

6230  { VK_SELECT, WXK_SELECT },
6231  { VK_PRINT, WXK_PRINT },
6232  { VK_EXECUTE, WXK_EXECUTE },
6233  { VK_SNAPSHOT, WXK_SNAPSHOT },
6234  { VK_HELP, WXK_HELP },

6237  { VK_NUMPAD1, WXK_NUMPAD1 },
6238  { VK_NUMPAD2, WXK_NUMPAD2 },
6239  { VK_NUMPAD3, WXK_NUMPAD3 },

6288 
6289 int VKToWX(WXWORD vk, WXLPARAM lParam, wchar_t *uc)
6290 {
6291  int wxk;
6292 
6293  // check the table first
6294  for ( size_t n = 0; n < WXSIZEOF(gs_specialKeys); n++ )
6295  {
6296  if ( gs_specialKeys[n].vk == vk )
6297  {
6298  wxk = gs_specialKeys[n].wxk;
6299  if ( wxk < WXK_START )
6300  {
6301  // Unicode code for this key is the same as its ASCII code.
6302  if ( uc )
6303  *uc = wxk;
6304  }
6305 
6306  return wxk;
6307  }
6308  }
6309 
6310  // keys requiring special handling
6311  switch ( vk )
6312  {
6313  case VK_OEM_1:
6314  case VK_OEM_PLUS:
6315  case VK_OEM_COMMA:
6316  case VK_OEM_MINUS:
6317  case VK_OEM_PERIOD:
6318  case VK_OEM_2:
6319  case VK_OEM_3:
6320  case VK_OEM_4:
6321  case VK_OEM_5:
6322  case VK_OEM_6:
6323  case VK_OEM_7:
6324  case VK_OEM_102:
6325  // MapVirtualKey() returns 0 if it fails to convert the virtual
6326  // key which nicely corresponds to our WXK_NONE.
6327  wxk = ::MapVirtualKey(vk, MAPVK_VK_TO_CHAR);
6328 
6329  if ( HIWORD(wxk) & 0x8000 )
6330  {
6331  // It's a dead key and we don't return anything at all for them
6332  // as we simply don't have any way to indicate the difference
6333  // between e.g. a normal "'" and "'" as a dead key -- and
6334  // generating the same events for them just doesn't seem like a
6335  // good idea.
6336  wxk = WXK_NONE;
6337  }
6338 
6339  // In any case return this as a Unicode character value.
6340  if ( uc )
6341  *uc = wxk;
6342 
6343  // For compatibility with the old non-Unicode code we continue
6344  // returning key codes for Latin-1 characters directly
6345  // (normally it would really only make sense to do it for the
6346  // ASCII characters, not Latin-1 ones).
6347  if ( wxk > 255 )
6348  {
6349  // But for anything beyond this we can only return the key
6350  // value as a real Unicode character, not a wxKeyCode
6351  // because this enum values clash with Unicode characters
6352  // (e.g. WXK_LBUTTON also happens to be U+012C a.k.a.
6353  // "LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH BREVE").
6354  wxk = WXK_NONE;
6355  }
6356  break;
6357 
6358  // handle extended keys
6359  case VK_PRIOR:
6360  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_PAGEUP, WXK_PAGEUP);
6361  break;
6362 
6363  case VK_NEXT:
6364  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_PAGEDOWN, WXK_PAGEDOWN);
6365  break;
6366 
6367  case VK_END:
6368  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_END, WXK_END);
6369  break;
6370 
6371  case VK_HOME:
6372  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_HOME, WXK_HOME);
6373  break;
6374 
6375  case VK_LEFT:
6376  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_LEFT, WXK_LEFT);
6377  break;
6378 
6379  case VK_UP:
6380  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_UP, WXK_UP);
6381  break;
6382 
6383  case VK_RIGHT:
6384  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_RIGHT, WXK_RIGHT);
6385  break;
6386 
6387  case VK_DOWN:
6388  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_DOWN, WXK_DOWN);
6389  break;
6390 
6391  case VK_INSERT:
6392  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_INSERT, WXK_INSERT);
6393  break;
6394 
6395  case VK_DELETE:
6396  wxk = ChooseNormalOrExtended(lParam, WXK_NUMPAD_DELETE, WXK_DELETE);
6397 
6398  if ( uc )
6399  *uc = WXK_DELETE;
6400  break;
6401 
6402  case VK_RETURN:
6403  // don't use ChooseNormalOrExtended() here as the keys are reversed
6404  // here: numpad enter is the extended one
6405  wxk = HIWORD(lParam) & KF_EXTENDED ? WXK_NUMPAD_ENTER : WXK_RETURN;
6406 
6407  if ( uc )
6408  *uc = WXK_RETURN;
6409  break;
6410 
6411  default:
6412  if ( (vk >= '0' && vk <= '9') || (vk >= 'A' && vk <= 'Z') )
6413  {
6414  // A simple alphanumeric key and the values of them coincide in
6415  // Windows and wx for both ASCII and Unicode codes.
6416  wxk = vk;
6417  }
6418  else // Something we simply don't know about at all.
6419  {
6420  wxk = WXK_NONE;
6421  }
6422 
6423  if ( uc )
6424  *uc = vk;
6425  }
6426 
6427  return wxk;
6428 }
6429 
6430 WXWORD WXToVK(int wxk, bool *isExtended)
6431 {
6432  // check the table first
6433  for ( size_t n = 0; n < WXSIZEOF(gs_specialKeys); n++ )
6434  {
6435  if ( gs_specialKeys[n].wxk == wxk )
6436  {
6437  // All extended keys (i.e. non-numpad versions of the keys that
6438  // exist both in the numpad and outside of it) are dealt with
6439  // below.
6440  if ( isExtended )
6441  *isExtended = false;
6442 
6443  return gs_specialKeys[n].vk;
6444  }
6445  }
6446 
6447  // and then check for special keys not included in the table
6448  bool extended = false;
6449  WXWORD vk;
6450  switch ( wxk )
6451  {
6452  case WXK_PAGEUP:
6453  extended = true;
6454  case WXK_NUMPAD_PAGEUP:
6455  vk = VK_PRIOR;
6456  break;
6457 
6458  case WXK_PAGEDOWN:
6459  extended = true;
6460  case WXK_NUMPAD_PAGEDOWN:
6461  vk = VK_NEXT;
6462  break;
6463 
6464  case WXK_END:
6465  extended = true;
6466  case WXK_NUMPAD_END:
6467  vk = VK_END;
6468  break;
6469 
6470  case WXK_HOME:
6471  extended = true;
6472  case WXK_NUMPAD_HOME:
6473  vk = VK_HOME;
6474  break;
6475 
6476  case WXK_LEFT:
6477  extended = true;
6478  case WXK_NUMPAD_LEFT:
6479  vk = VK_LEFT;
6480  break;
6481 
6482  case WXK_UP:
6483  extended = true;
6484  case WXK_NUMPAD_UP:
6485  vk = VK_UP;
6486  break;
6487 
6488  case WXK_RIGHT:
6489  extended = true;
6490  case WXK_NUMPAD_RIGHT:
6491  vk = VK_RIGHT;
6492  break;
6493 
6494  case WXK_DOWN:
6495  extended = true;
6496  case WXK_NUMPAD_DOWN:
6497  vk = VK_DOWN;
6498  break;
6499 
6500  case WXK_INSERT:
6501  extended = true;
6502  case WXK_NUMPAD_INSERT:
6503  vk = VK_INSERT;
6504  break;
6505 
6506  case WXK_DELETE:
6507  extended = true;
6508  case WXK_NUMPAD_DELETE:
6509  vk = VK_DELETE;
6510  break;
6511 
6512  default:
6513  // no VkKeyScan() under CE unfortunately, we need to test how does
6514  // it handle OEM keys
6515 #ifndef __WXWINCE__
6516  // check to see if its one of the OEM key codes.
6517  BYTE vks = LOBYTE(VkKeyScan(wxk));
6518  if ( vks != 0xff )
6519  {
6520  vk = vks;
6521  }
6522  else
6523 #endif // !__WXWINCE__
6524  {
6525  vk = (WXWORD)wxk;
6526  }
6527  }
6528 
6529  if ( isExtended )
6530  *isExtended = extended;
6531 
6532  return vk;
6533 }
6534 
6535 } // namespace wxMSWKeyboard
6536 
6537 // small helper for wxGetKeyState() and wxGetMouseState()
6538 static inline bool wxIsKeyDown(WXWORD vk)
6539 {
6540  // SM_SWAPBUTTON is not available under CE, so don't swap buttons there
6541 #ifdef SM_SWAPBUTTON
6542  if ( vk == VK_LBUTTON || vk == VK_RBUTTON )
6543  {
6544  if ( ::GetSystemMetrics(SM_SWAPBUTTON) )
6545  {
6546  if ( vk == VK_LBUTTON )
6547  vk = VK_RBUTTON;
6548  else // vk == VK_RBUTTON
6549  vk = VK_LBUTTON;
6550  }
6551  }
6552 #endif // SM_SWAPBUTTON
6553 
6554  // the low order bit indicates whether the key was pressed since the last
6555  // call and the high order one indicates whether it is down right now and
6556  // we only want that one
6557  return (GetAsyncKeyState(vk) & (1<<15)) != 0;
6558 }
6559 
6560 bool wxGetKeyState(wxKeyCode key)
6561 {
6562  // although this does work under Windows, it is not supported under other
6563  // platforms so don't allow it, you must use wxGetMouseState() instead
6564  wxASSERT_MSG( key != VK_LBUTTON &&
6565  key != VK_RBUTTON &&
6566  key != VK_MBUTTON,
6567  wxT("can't use wxGetKeyState() for mouse buttons") );
6568 
6569  const WXWORD vk = wxMSWKeyboard::WXToVK(key);
6570 
6571  // if the requested key is a LED key, return true if the led is pressed
6572  if ( key == WXK_NUMLOCK || key == WXK_CAPITAL || key == WXK_SCROLL )
6573  {
6574  // low order bit means LED is highlighted and high order one means the
6575  // key is down; for compatibility with the other ports return true if
6576  // either one is set
6577  return GetKeyState(vk) != 0;
6578 
6579  }
6580  else // normal key
6581  {
6582  return wxIsKeyDown(vk);
6583  }
6584 }
6585 
6586 
6587 wxMouseState wxGetMouseState()
6588 {
6589  wxMouseState ms;
6590  POINT pt;
6591  wxGetCursorPosMSW(&pt);
6592 
6593  ms.SetX(pt.x);
6594  ms.SetY(pt.y);
6595  ms.SetLeftDown(wxIsKeyDown(VK_LBUTTON));
6596  ms.SetMiddleDown(wxIsKeyDown(VK_MBUTTON));
6597  ms.SetRightDown(wxIsKeyDown(VK_RBUTTON));
6598 #ifdef wxHAS_XBUTTON
6599  ms.SetAux1Down(wxIsKeyDown(VK_XBUTTON1));
6600  ms.SetAux2Down(wxIsKeyDown(VK_XBUTTON2));
6601 #endif // wxHAS_XBUTTON
6602 
6603  ms.SetControlDown(wxIsCtrlDown ());
6604  ms.SetShiftDown (wxIsShiftDown());
6605  ms.SetAltDown (wxIsAltDown ());
6606 // ms.SetMetaDown();
6607 
6608  return ms;
6609 }

6612 wxWindow *wxGetActiveWindow()
6613 {
6614  HWND hWnd = GetActiveWindow();
6615  if ( hWnd != 0 )
6616  {
6617  return wxFindWinFromHandle(hWnd);
6618  }
6619  return NULL;
6620 }
6621 
6622 extern wxWindow *wxGetWindowFromHWND(WXHWND hWnd)
6623 {
6624  HWND hwnd = (HWND)hWnd;
6625 
6626  // For a radiobutton, we get the radiobox from GWL_USERDATA (which is set
6627  // by code in msw/radiobox.cpp), for all the others we just search up the
6628  // window hierarchy
6629  wxWindow *win = NULL;
6630  if ( hwnd )
6631  {
6632  win = wxFindWinFromHandle(hwnd);
6633  if ( !win )
6634  {
6635 #if wxUSE_RADIOBOX && !defined(__WXUNIVERSAL__)
6636  // native radiobuttons return DLGC_RADIOBUTTON here and for any
6637  // wxWindow class which overrides WM_GETDLGCODE processing to
6638  // do it as well, win would be already non NULL
6639  if ( ::SendMessage(hwnd, WM_GETDLGCODE, 0, 0) & DLGC_RADIOBUTTON )
6640  {
6641  win = wxRadioBox::GetFromRadioButtonHWND(hwnd);
6642  }
6643  //else: it's a wxRadioButton, not a radiobutton from wxRadioBox
6644 #endif // wxUSE_RADIOBOX
6645 
6646  // spin control text buddy window should be mapped to spin ctrl
6647  // itself so try it too
6648 #if wxUSE_SPINCTRL && !defined(__WXUNIVERSAL__)
6649  if ( !win )
6650  {
6651  win = wxSpinCtrl::GetSpinForTextCtrl((WXHWND)hwnd);
6652  }
6653 #endif // wxUSE_SPINCTRL
6654  }
6655  }
6656 
6657  while ( hwnd && !win )
6658  {
6659  // this is a really ugly hack needed to avoid mistakenly returning the
6660  // parent frame wxWindow for the find/replace modeless dialog HWND -
6661  // this, in turn, is needed to call IsDialogMessage() from
6662  // wxApp::ProcessMessage() as for this we must return NULL from here
6663  //
6664  // FIXME: this is clearly not the best way to do it but I think we'll
6665  // need to change HWND <-> wxWindow code more heavily than I can
6666  // do it now to fix it
6667 #ifndef __WXMICROWIN__
6668  if ( ::GetWindow(hwnd, GW_OWNER) )
6669  {
6670  // it's a dialog box, don't go upwards
6671  break;
6672  }
6673 #endif
6674 
6675  hwnd = ::GetParent(hwnd);
6676  win = wxFindWinFromHandle(hwnd);
6677  }
6678 
6679  return win;
6680 }
6681 
6682 #if !defined(__WXMICROWIN__) && !defined(__WXWINCE__)
6683 
6684 // Windows keyboard hook. Allows interception of e.g. F1, ESCAPE
6685 // in active frames and dialogs, regardless of where the focus is.
6686 static HHOOK wxTheKeyboardHook = 0;
6687 
6688 int APIENTRY
6689 wxKeyboardHook(int nCode, WORD wParam, DWORD lParam)
6690 {
6691  DWORD hiWord = HIWORD(lParam);
6692  if ( nCode != HC_NOREMOVE && ((hiWord & KF_UP) == 0) )
6693  {
6694  wchar_t uc = 0;
6695  int id = wxMSWKeyboard::VKToWX(wParam, lParam, &uc);
6696 
6697  // Don't intercept keyboard entry (notably Escape) if a modal window
6698  // (not managed by wx, e.g. IME one) is currently opened as more often
6699  // than not it needs all the keys for itself.
6700  //
6701  // Also don't catch it if a window currently captures the mouse as
6702  // Escape is normally used to release the mouse capture and if you
6703  // really need to catch all the keys in the window that has mouse
6704  // capture it can be easily done in its own EVT_CHAR handler as it is
6705  // certain to have focus while it has the capture.
6706  if ( !gs_modalEntryWindowCount && !::GetCapture() )
6707  {
6708  if ( id != WXK_NONE
6709 #if wxUSE_UNICODE
6710  || static_cast<int>(uc) != WXK_NONE
6711 #endif // wxUSE_UNICODE
6712  )
6713  {
6714  wxWindow const* win = wxWindow::DoFindFocus();
6715  if ( !win )
6716  {
6717  // Even if the focus got lost somehow, still send the event
6718  // to the top level parent to allow a wxDialog to always
6719  // close on Escape.
6720  win = wxGetActiveWindow();
6721  }
6722 
6723  wxKeyEvent event(wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK);
6724  MSWInitAnyKeyEvent(event, wParam, lParam, win);
6725 
6726  event.m_keyCode = id;
6727 #if wxUSE_UNICODE
6728  event.m_uniChar = uc;
6729 #endif // wxUSE_UNICODE
6730 
6731  wxEvtHandler * const handler = win ? win->GetEventHandler()
6732  : wxTheApp;
6733 
6734  if ( handler && handler->ProcessEvent(event) )
6735  {
6736  if ( !event.IsNextEventAllowed() )
6737  {
6738  // Stop processing of this event.
6739  return 1;
6740  }
6741  }
6742  }
6743  }
6744  }
6745 
6746  return (int)CallNextHookEx(wxTheKeyboardHook, nCode, wParam, lParam);
6747 }
6748 
6749 void wxSetKeyboardHook(bool doIt)
6750 {
6751  if ( doIt )
6752  {
6753  wxTheKeyboardHook = ::SetWindowsHookEx
6754  (
6755  WH_KEYBOARD,
6756  (HOOKPROC)wxKeyboardHook,
6757  NULL, // must be NULL for process hook
6758  ::GetCurrentThreadId()
6759  );
6760  if ( !wxTheKeyboardHook )
6761  {
6762  wxLogLastError(wxT("SetWindowsHookEx(wxKeyboardHook)"));
6763  }
6764  }
6765  else // uninstall
6766  {
6767  if ( wxTheKeyboardHook )
6768  ::UnhookWindowsHookEx(wxTheKeyboardHook);
6769  }
6770 }
6771 
6772 #endif // !__WXMICROWIN__

7249 static TEXTMETRIC wxGetTextMetrics(const wxWindowMSW *win)
7250 {
7251  // prepare the DC
7252  TEXTMETRIC tm;
7253  HWND hwnd = GetHwndOf(win);
7254  HDC hdc = ::GetDC(hwnd);
7255 
7256 #if !wxDIALOG_UNIT_COMPATIBILITY
7257  // and select the current font into it
7258  HFONT hfont = GetHfontOf(win->GetFont());
7259  if ( hfont )
7260  {
7261  hfont = (HFONT)::SelectObject(hdc, hfont);
7262  }
7263 #endif
7264 
7265  // finally retrieve the text metrics from it
7266  GetTextMetrics(hdc, &tm);
7267 
7268 #if !wxDIALOG_UNIT_COMPATIBILITY
7269  // and clean up
7270  if ( hfont )
7271  {
7272  (void)::SelectObject(hdc, hfont);
7273  }
7274 #endif
7275 
7276  ::ReleaseDC(hwnd, hdc);
7277 
7278  return tm;
7279 }

7281 // Find the wxWindow at the current mouse position, returning the mouse
7282 // position.
7283 wxWindow* wxFindWindowAtPointer(wxPoint& pt)
7284 {
7285  pt = wxGetMousePosition();

7287 }
7288 
7289 wxWindow* wxFindWindowAtPoint(const wxPoint& pt)
7290 {
7291  POINT pt2;
7292  pt2.x = pt.x;
7293  pt2.y = pt.y;
7294 
7295  HWND hWnd = ::WindowFromPoint(pt2);
7296  if ( hWnd )
7297  {
7298  // WindowFromPoint() ignores the disabled children but we're supposed
7299  // to take them into account, so check if we have a child at this
7300  // coordinate using ChildWindowFromPointEx().
7301  for ( ;; )
7302  {
7303  pt2.x = pt.x;
7304  pt2.y = pt.y;
7305  ::ScreenToClient(hWnd, &pt2);
7306  HWND child = ::ChildWindowFromPointEx(hWnd, pt2, CWP_SKIPINVISIBLE);
7307  if ( child == hWnd || !child )
7308  break;
7309 
7310  // ChildWindowFromPointEx() only examines the immediate children
7311  // but we want to get the deepest (top in Z-order) one, so continue
7312  // iterating for as long as it finds anything.
7313  hWnd = child;
7314  }
7315  }
7316 
7317  return wxGetWindowFromHWND((WXHWND)hWnd);
7318 }
7319 
7320 // Get the current mouse position.
7321 wxPoint wxGetMousePosition()
7322 {
7323  POINT pt;
7324  wxGetCursorPosMSW(&pt);
7325 
7326  return wxPoint(pt.x, pt.y);
7327 }

7332 static void WinCEUnregisterHotKey(int modifiers, int id)
7333 {
7334  // Register hotkeys for the hardware buttons
7335  HINSTANCE hCoreDll;
7336  typedef BOOL (WINAPI *UnregisterFunc1Proc)(UINT, UINT);
7337

7339  hCoreDll = LoadLibrary(wxT("coredll.dll"));
7340  if (hCoreDll)

7346  }

7350 bool wxWindowMSW::RegisterHotKey(int hotkeyId, int modifiers, int keycode)
7351 {
7352  UINT win_modifiers=0;
7353  if ( modifiers & wxMOD_ALT )
7354  win_modifiers |= MOD_ALT;
7355  if ( modifiers & wxMOD_SHIFT )
7356  win_modifiers |= MOD_SHIFT;
7357  if ( modifiers & wxMOD_CONTROL )
7358  win_modifiers |= MOD_CONTROL;
7359  if ( modifiers & wxMOD_WIN )
7360  win_modifiers |= MOD_WIN;
7361 
7362 #if defined(__SMARTPHONE__) || defined(__POCKETPC__)
7363  // Required for PPC and Smartphone hardware buttons
7364  if (keycode >= WXK_SPECIAL1 && keycode <= WXK_SPECIAL20)
7365  WinCEUnregisterHotKey(win_modifiers, hotkeyId);
7366 #endif
7367 
7368  if ( !::RegisterHotKey(GetHwnd(), hotkeyId, win_modifiers, keycode) )
7369  {
7370  wxLogLastError(wxT("RegisterHotKey"));
7371 
7372  return false;
7373  }
7374 
7375  return true;
7376 }
7377 
7378 bool wxWindowMSW::UnregisterHotKey(int hotkeyId)
7379 {
7380 #if defined(__SMARTPHONE__) || defined(__POCKETPC__)
7381  WinCEUnregisterHotKey(MOD_WIN, hotkeyId);
7382 #endif
7383 
7384  if ( !::UnregisterHotKey(GetHwnd(), hotkeyId) )
7385  {
7386  wxLogLastError(wxT("UnregisterHotKey"));
7387 
7388  return false;
7389  }
7390 
7391  return true;
7392 }

7394 bool wxWindowMSW::HandleHotKey(WXWPARAM wParam, WXLPARAM lParam)
7395 {
7396  int win_modifiers = LOWORD(lParam);
7397 
7398  wxKeyEvent event(CreateKeyEvent(wxEVT_HOTKEY, HIWORD(lParam)));
7399  event.SetId(wParam);
7400  event.m_shiftDown = (win_modifiers & MOD_SHIFT) != 0;
7401  event.m_controlDown = (win_modifiers & MOD_CONTROL) != 0;
7402  event.m_altDown = (win_modifiers & MOD_ALT) != 0;
7403  event.m_metaDown = (win_modifiers & MOD_WIN) != 0;
7404 
7405  return HandleWindowEvent(event);
7406 }

7413 // this class installs a message hook which really wakes up our idle processing
7414 // each time a WM_NULL is received (wxWakeUpIdle does this), even if we're
7415 // sitting inside a local modal loop (e.g. a menu is opened or scrollbar is
7416 // being dragged or even inside ::MessageBox()) and so don't control message
7417 // dispatching otherwise
7418 class wxIdleWakeUpModule : public wxModule
7419 {
7420 public:
7421  virtual bool OnInit()
7422  {
7423  ms_hMsgHookProc = ::SetWindowsHookEx
7424  (
7425  WH_GETMESSAGE,
7426  &wxIdleWakeUpModule::MsgHookProc,
7427  NULL,
7428  GetCurrentThreadId()
7429  );
7430 
7431  if ( !ms_hMsgHookProc )
7432  {
7433  wxLogLastError(wxT("SetWindowsHookEx(WH_GETMESSAGE)"));
7434 
7435  return false;
7436  }
7437 
7438  return true;
7439  }
7440 
7441  virtual void OnExit()
7442  {
7443  ::UnhookWindowsHookEx(wxIdleWakeUpModule::ms_hMsgHookProc);
7444  }
7445 
7446  static LRESULT CALLBACK MsgHookProc(int nCode, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
7447  {
7448  MSG *msg = (MSG*)lParam;
7449 
7450  // only process the message if it is actually going to be removed from
7451  // the message queue, this prevents that the same event from being
7452  // processed multiple times if now someone just called PeekMessage()
7453  if ( msg->message == WM_NULL && wParam == PM_REMOVE )
7454  {
7455  wxTheApp->ProcessPendingEvents();
7456  }
7457 
7458  return CallNextHookEx(ms_hMsgHookProc, nCode, wParam, lParam);
7459  }
7460 
7461 private:
7462  static HHOOK ms_hMsgHookProc;
7463 
7464  DECLARE_DYNAMIC_CLASS(wxIdleWakeUpModule)
7465 };
7466 
7467 HHOOK wxIdleWakeUpModule::ms_hMsgHookProc = 0;
7468 
7469 IMPLEMENT_DYNAMIC_CLASS(wxIdleWakeUpModule, wxModule)
7470 
7471 #endif // __WXWINCE__
7472 
7473 #ifdef __WXWINCE__
7474 
7475 #if wxUSE_STATBOX
7476 static void wxAdjustZOrder(wxWindow* parent)
7477 {
7478  if (wxDynamicCast(parent, wxStaticBox))
7479  {
7480  // Set the z-order correctly
7481  SetWindowPos((HWND) parent->GetHWND(), HWND_BOTTOM, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE|SWP_NOSIZE);
7482  }
7483 
7484  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator current = parent->GetChildren().GetFirst();
7485  while (current)
7486  {
7487  wxWindow *childWin = current->GetData();
7488  wxAdjustZOrder(childWin);
7489  current = current->GetNext();
7490  }
7491 }
7492 #endif
